"Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance", Rated "PG-13" for Adult Situations, Adult Language, Strong Violence, Disturbing Imagery. Running Time: 1hr&35mns.My Take *1/2 (Out of ****) Oh dear. How should I start? I went to "Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance" and I overheard people during the end credits talk amongst themselves. "I couldn't wait to see this movie" said one gentleman. His colleague recounted with "I couldn't wait for it to end." To be fair, here's another incident: I found myself talking with an aquaintence later on who also saw the feature. I mentioned that I planned to write a review on this movie. This was followed by a wincing face while he very softly said "Ooooooh!" As he shook his head, I knew with certainty this movie would be discussed in hushed tones by those who had seen it.For the uninitiated, "Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance" is the indirect sequel to 2007's "Ghost Rider." These movies are based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name with the same premise. Johnny Blaze (Nicolas Cage) is a daredevil stunt motorcyclist who made a pact with Mephistopheles (Ciaran Hinds, "John Carter") to cure his father's cancer in exchange for his soul. After a cruel twist of fate, Blaze got burned in the deal, losing his soul and becoming a demonic pawn of dark forces. He now has supernatural abilities and is able change at will into a fiery skull-headed demon known as "The Rider," who has a fierce sense of justice. In this form, he is nearly indestructible and uses flaming chains as weapons.The new movie finds Blaze eight years after the events of the first picture. The cursed loner has left behind his normal life and is living a meager existence in Eastern Europe.In his earthly guise of "Rourke," the devil is tracking his own son Danny (Fergus Riordan, "I Want to Be a Soldier") in order to inhabit his body. Rourke's current body is dying, as the devil in human form weakens the host. To do Rourke's bidding, the mercenary Ray Carrigan (Johnny Whitworth, "Gamer") and his merry band of goons are hot on Danny's trail.The boy and his mother Nadya (Violante Placido) are hiding within a monastery's castle when it is stormed. All the monks are killed and the duo is on the run. The drunken priest Moreau (Idris Elba, "Thor") finds and recruits Johnny Blaze to help protect the boy from the devil's insidious plan. Blaze is reluctant to unleash "The Rider" to defend Danny and make battle with the dark forces pursuing the boy. Moreau makes Blaze an offer he cannot refuse: access to a supernatural sect that can lift Blaze's curse and free him from his dark pact. With the prospect to regain his soul, how could he possibly say "no" to that?A conflict with the Ghost Rider leaves Carrigan dead. He is resurrected by Rourke as the dreaded Blackout, complete with supernatural abilities to siphon life and to decay anything he touches. A great example of his newfound powers is handled somewhat amusingly: Blackout touches a sandwich and it decays. Then he touches an apple, it too dissolves. Nothing happens when he picks up a Twinkie, affirming that a Twinkie will last forever. In this case, the Twinkie can even withstand evil powers.The Ghost Rider's new look is awesome, having been modified from the previous picture. This time, the skull is charred black, fierce and menacing. When the Rider sucks the sole of a baddie from him, he is truly a horrific force to be reckoned with. Towers of flames spirals off the Rider like a geyser. The way the Rider's leather jacket smolders, bubbles and smokes is a really great detail I haven't seen in the movies before.The MTV-like camera work was notably atrocious. Many scenes are presented with animation and other graphics that happen so quickly, when they are over you're not sure what happened. The hip, fluid, linear approach I am sure the filmmakers were going for is completely upstaged by an oversaturation of the medium. The effect is dizzying, unnerving and, quite frankly, amateur looking. How about the sound? I half wondered if I was going to be partially deaf for a day after seeing the movie, much like the day after a Motley Crue concert, due to the non-stop barrage of loud action sequences and ear-pounding music. If you want to replicate the effect, just put a metal bucket over your head and let a six-year old drum on it with a pair of mallets.I'm sure the studio felt there could be no wrong in green-lighting this picture. The 2007 original actually grossed money despite being panned by most critics. This new movie boasts a very impressive screen writing credit: that of David S. Goyer. He is best known as the man who breathed new life into the Batman revision for the films "Batman Begins" (2005) and "The Dark Knight" (2008). Surely, he was believed to be able to reinvigorate the Ghost Rider franchise after its dismal 2007 start."Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance" is an un-engaging and un-interesting film that is an incoherent mess. I cannot fathom why anyone thought making this movie could possibly have been a good idea. It's frantic, chaotic and downright ugly. There is no sense of awe or fun, which is something you would want in a comic book based movie. If someone wanted to write a thesis on why they should stop making comic book movies, look no further than "Ghost Rider II." Though, the comic book film gods will be working overtime this summer with the anticipated releases of "The Avengers," "The Amazing Spider-Man" and "The Dark Knight Rises" (co-storied by Goyer). Hopefully any one of those films, if not all of them, can quell the memory of this disaster and save the genre from itself.

reviews.review_title: Like punisher warzone?, you might like this. like GR1 but not 2? stick to spider-man.
reviews.content: So they say that while it has nicholas cage again as blaze, it's actually more of a reboot than a sequel. So it's a bit like what they did with the punisher/ punisher: warzone, and even hulk/incredible hulk films. With each film they tried doing a new start with an origin story to kick things off with... Then when those films flopped and they wanted to do more films with those characters later, they decide to reboot but rather than retread more origin stories (that people are getting sick to death of) they decided to just do a recap-heads-up of what their deal is pre-credits or during, so they could get on with a separate story to focus on. And for each film these reboots bettered the originals by pushing the action factor.With what i read i thought GR:SOV was going to be rubbish, but i was pleasantly surprised. what made this rewatchable was mainly both the action scenes at the construction site and the road chase later on, they were much better than the none event fights in the first film against the demons, and telling helicopter to go away... I heard the new skull had too much black smoke obscuring it, but no, it doesn't. The new skull is loads better, and on rewatching the first again I found GR1 to look far too cgi clean. The new rider has more chaotic personality than previous, perhaps because cage had his head rigged up and actually acted the skull out rather than a computer simulating movement and speech. This film leans more towards the darker grit side though not full on punisher warzone grit due to certification. They really shouldn't bother marketing marvel knights to kids, it's like keeping the training wheels on. Luckily it doesn't really effect this film. If you don't like this film, but liked the first then maybe you should stick to spider-man, because this one is closer to how movie ghost rider should be. Or even how a knights movie should be. The first encounter isn't very eventful, and the story just holds the scenes inline, but at least there is a proper villain this time in the form of blackout. If they do another, rather than yet another blaze reboot, i'd like to see the power passed onto the danny ketch version.

reviews.review_title: It's better to forget this movie.
reviews.content: As I said before, in the review I wrote for "Ghost Rider", I'm not a fan or even an expert in comics, so I'll ignore the source material and focus on the movie. I'm not the right person to say whether or not it's a reliable adaptation. However, I can already say that it is a bad movie. With all its weaknesses, the first film was a work of art when compared to this unfortunate piece.The biggest problem with this movie is that it's a sequel designed to make money. Producers and studios didn't even bother to try to disguise their greed, and rubbed their hands at the good box office obtained. Poorly received by critics, the target of numerous criticisms from the public, but a relative success at the box office, the initial film paved the way for this sequel, which wouldn't be bad if it was a good sequel. Unfortunately, almost the entire cast and crew of the first film (except for Nicolas Cage) is absent from this project, which adopts a totally different visual and dramatic language from the previous film and, thus, cuts any hypothetical continuity.The script is mediocre and is based on a fight between Johnny Blaze and especially powerful evil forces that want to kidnap a child, supposedly the son of the Devil, key-figure to Armageddon. Simple, extremely clichéd, very poorly crafted and poorly developed, it's a script worthy of a 70's B-movie. All the dense atmosphere and something sinister we saw in the initial film is totally absent, having been replaced by something lighter, "hard rock" and eventually designed for young adults and teenagers aspiring to be rockers. The fast pace with which everything happens favors the logical flaws, which appear in the script with the magnificence of Baroque palaces, being impossible to ignore them: the case of the monks, with medieval robes and caves coexisting with high-tech devices, weapons that would suffice for Ukraine for a year, and wine capable of getting half the Russian troops drunk, is one of the most egregious. I'd rather not talk about the ability to decompose objects and food that one of the characters will acquire at the end, and that seem to work only when it's convenient for the film.Nicolas Cage is still present in the film, but he is the only one from the previous cast to do so, since all the others, especially Eva Mendes and Peter Fonda, dropped out of the project after reading the script. Smart decision. Cage, if not brilliant in the first film, is mediocre in the sequel, with a one-dimensional, apathetic and sleepy interpretation. Ciarán Hinds is doing well and doing a great job and very worthy, but he doesn't have much to do, while Violante Placido and Idris Elba, despite their efforts and some good moments, don't make more than an average effort.Technically, the film bets massively on CGI, of great visual and dramatic effect, with the flames and the whole apparatus around the Rider reaching hyperbolic levels. The mine scenes are perhaps the most obvious example of what I'm saying: enough bullets for a military battle, fire everywhere, that huge machine... everything taken to the extreme for visual grandeur and spectacularity. It sometimes worked, there's no denying it, but it often feels like something out of a computer game. Set in an area of Central Europe, the film was partially shot in Romania and makes good use of the beauty of the chosen locations. The sets and costumes are decent given the script and location, and the soundtrack is heavy, tiresome and uninteresting. Worse, however, are the sound effects used, as they are often clearly fake.

reviews.review_title: This movie's good. It knows it's stupid.
reviews.content: I'm not gonna say this is the superhero movie of the century, or that it's a breath of fresh air but it does a lot right. For a sequel to one of the worst superhero movies ever made, they got two directors who actually know what they wanted to do. Make it absolutely insane in every opportunity that the script gives us.Why does the action work so well here and actually make the film good? Because there's a comedic silliness to it all that you can so tell the filmmakers had a blast with. Scenes end with literal punchlines. Jokes are made through visuals. It's as smart of a comedy as it is of an action film. It's a smart-stupid movie and good for it. Nicolas Cage is giving his all and it's clever he did the motion capture work for Ghost Rider as it feels like a Nicolas Cage character. It's one of the better superhero movies I've seen in a while.

Before I review, let's get out of the way that the 1st Ghost Rider, while flawed, was good and it felt like an actual movie. This movie was a bit of an eyesore.First, the plot. The plot didn't flow really well. It could have been a great film if it was pieced together properly. But the scene transitions were awful and it jumbled the movie into a huge mess. Because of that, this movie was not explained adequately, like how could Johnny want to lift his curse when he said he was going to own his curse at the end of the first film? Actually, that also brings me to another thing that went wrong with it.That would be the editing. The motion capture seems like a ripoff of the reality show Survivor. It would zoom into the scene, sometimes unnecessarily, and that honestly made my head spin. If they were going to use such a tool, at least use it to help tell the story and not make us dizzy!This movie also failed on making the devil. The devil didn't look so... tame-looking. The devil in the first movie looked so much more like a devil should look like. The new characters were all flat too. Idris Elba's character was banal, I didn't care for the mother and I only rooted for her because she was hot. Nor did I care about Danny because he did nothing to make him stand out in any notable way.So why 4 stars? Because any time Johnny becomes the Ghost Rider, it makes the movie worthwhile. He at least retains his badassery, which is demonstrated with, for example, the transforming of machines into fiery weapons. Johnny isn't annoying in his human form either. His connection with his Ghost Rider spirit at least does get more exposition when the rest of the movie doesn't. It is the actual Ghost Rider himself that keeps this movie from being one of the worst movies ever.

Let me start off by saying I am one of the few people who absolutely loved the first Ghost Rider! It was and still is one of my favorite films and that is why I feel like I was just punched in the stomach by Sylvester Stallone! These people took one of my all time favorite superheroes and make him a complete joke! When I was a young lad and watched Ghost Rider for the first time I fell in love with every element of it (apparently I was one of the only ones, oh well people have opinions) and when I saw that there was going to be a sequel in the near future I got my hopes up and began the wait When the trailer came out I thought it looked pretty decent, like it was gonna be a fun ride...I was wrong, oh so very wrong. The way Mark Neveldine and Brain Taylor direct is simply horrendous and hard to watch, everything moves so fast and the camera won't stay still for a second, it gives me a bloody headache, but that's just my opinion. And the list goes on! They changed the Ghost Rider from a BA avenger who gave bad guys what they deserved into a complete and utter joke. One of the things that stuck with me from the first film was the penance stare, I was praying to see a lot of this! All he does is yell, no cool little tricks, he just yells and incinerates people, that's it. However this is just my opinion, if you are a big fan of the Crank movies or are a big adrenalin junkie give it a try.

reviews.review_title: Watch out! your skull will be on fire too (Because of an headache!)
reviews.content: The sequel makes Ghost Rider 1 look like a classic! Ghost Rider 1 had some semblance of a story and was a proper 'Masala' film. Ghost rider:Spirit of Vengeance is a poorly written movie. And the plot seems as though made up on the sets as the shooting was progressing! Nic Cage looks confused as Blaze and as the Ghost Rider. And so does everyone else in the film!! Even Idris Elba was reduced to a bumbling fool. So the casting was definitely terrible. And a movie is generally special if the chemistry between the characters is special. But here very little time is invested in developing any relationship between the characters. And why was this movie made in 3D? The only 3D part of this film I enjoyed was right at the beginning, even before the movie started - The ad for "Real 3D" ! I still give the movie 2 stars because I like how the movie ends promising a conceptually different take for another sequel (if at all it happens).
I know it's an unpopular opinion but I though Nicholas cage was perfect for the part and something about the movie has always made me really enjoy it

When your 11 year old son says he's disappointed with a high octane, flaming skull headed, comic book character based movie, then you know your onto a loser. The acting was poor (including Cage) and the direction was haphazard. Nicholas Cage seemed, all through the movie, like he'd been turning up on set just to collect his massive pay cheque and was constantly putting in minimal effort. The story line was a mixed up mess of various other devil/hell related movies. The action was good, the CGI was also good but this didn't make up for the dull interludes. The original movie, whilst not great, encouraged me to see this one but the 2 films are like chalk and cheese. I actually dozed off towards the end of the 2nd third! I don't often write reviews, usually only for very good or, like in this case,very very bad films so.... Please, please, please don't waste your hard earned money going to see this dreary movie!

reviews.review_title: Terrible, not good enough to be bad
reviews.content: Nicholas Cage: is he mad, or does he act mad? Who cares, he's terrible, and gets worse with each film. This movie is no exception. It's idiotic even for a superhero film. Terrible, clunky CGI, terrible performances throughout the cast, a script presumably scraped together from The Big Book of Marvel Cliches, and very poor action sequences. Humourless, weird, and charmless, with zero sympathetic characters. Truly one of the worst films I have ever seen.Does this review contain spoilers? How could it? It would be impossible to do anything to this movie to spoil it. The film makers already did that.

reviews.review_title: So far the worst movie of the year
reviews.content: If you don't see the plot on this page, then there is a problem with the plot. Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance storyline did not make any sense of all. I was trying to figure out what in the world is going on, but within five minutes it was too late. It was heading for disaster. What was the whole purchase? To be honest I don't know. All I can say is that the plot was useless. My question is that why in the world would Columbia Pictures would green-light this movie? If the first movie was bad, why bother making a sequel? Did anybody actually bother to read the script? I guess not. David S. Goyer, the co-writer of The Dark Knight and this film, either should've rewritten the script or shouldn't get involve with the project at all. The dialogue is enormously cheesy and poorly delivered. For example, Nicolas Cage is having a conversation with a kid name Daniel who says "Did we win?" and he replays "Yes, hell yes. Hell (he said the f word, but I can't say it) yeah." See what I mean. Nicolas Cage delivers the worst performance of his career. His role was extremely over the top and hilarious because how bad it was. Sometimes I feel sorry for the man because he has no choice but to play these kinds of roles due to the problems with his taxes (He apparently owns $20 million to the IRS). Films like Cloverfield, The Bourne Trilogy, and The Prestige are mostly shot using hand-held technique and are well used, but not this film. Instead the technique was poorly used because it was too fast and too shaky. Sometimes we need action sequence to cheer us up, but even the action scenes did not save the movie. It was plain out boring. The special effects are a mess for an $80 million budget.In the end, Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance is a waist of time. It will go down in history as one of the worst comic book films of all time. To be honest, I nearly walked out at the movie, but somewhere in my heart, I decided not to, but I wish I did.F-

reviews.review_title: For all the good it DOES do, it's far from enough.
reviews.content: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance, aka Ghost Rider 2, is so far removed from the first movie that it's a surprise they got Nicolas Cage to reprise the character at all. It's a guilty pleasure film that's got such potently watchable ironic material that you wish the script wasn't as hollow as it so obviously shows itself out to be on the screen.Ghost Rider 2 could have worked as a singular story but it's just utilising the one thing going for it carried over from the first movie: and that's Nicolas Cage as Johnny Blaze, The Ghost Rider. Besides the admittedly awesome skeletal warrior showing up on screen and being a genuinely good element of the film, the character's badassery isn't complemented by the film's lacklustre screenplay; though it's nice there's some good action here and there, and Idris Elba's always a scene-stealer even if he's at the mercy of a crappy story.Ghost Rider 2; one of the movies of all time, and one of the 2010s' defining 'because movie' films to ever come from Hollywood. Good or bad, there's something to take away here even if it's mostly stuff that's NOT in the film. It goes to show that a singularly awesome character NEEDS an equally awesome ensemble of supporting characters to work, otherwise the story just doesn't feel worthwhile and sadly pointless.This is good ironic viewing; if you're expecting a genuinely good time, get ready to reevaluate your expectations before you watch. 1/5 stars.

Terrible movie all throughout. I had never seen Ghost Rider and decided to get a go at it because I recall at the time that it was a movie that I really wanted to see. The story in itself is quite terrible and as always oriented around romance and these kind of nonsense. The thing I don't understand and did not understand throughout all the movie which was emphasized by certain scenes is if the devil is omniscient, like he is in reality and just like God, then you really have to ask then how comes he never sees anything coming and especially when they (the normal humans beings) are about to deliver the boy ? This does not make any sense at all.Secondly, the action scenes are quite terrible and fake. You could read the chord or whatever method they used to construct the fights, guide the actors during these periods [...] quite catastrophic.I generally hate action movies because you can always feel the tendencies of the writers to pull for a certain end and this movie, halfway through, you already knew all what was to be known as of how the story was going to unfold. I find that terrible and quite a waste because it really has potential. Certain actions in the film are also quite non explainable, for example the fact that the mother was able to catch the group in like about 5 minutes when they had already left her way behind in that dome, or, whatever that was. Terrible and would not recommend such a movie to anyone.

reviews.review_title: This movie makes Batman and Robin look good.
reviews.content: I can honestly say that this movie is what you would call an "Epic Fail" from beginning to end. Absolutely everything about it was terrible. The story was incomprehensible, the characters were lame, the action was blurry and confused, and the cinematography was trash.If anyone told me that this movie had a good story, I'd punch them in the face. There was absolutely no story! I had no idea what Nicolas Cage was doing. I couldn't make out any of the characters' motives for doing whatever it was they were doing, for that matter. I couldn't even understand half of what they were saying! The pacing in the movie was so choppy, it made me wonder what kind of drunk, screwed-up people wrote this piece of garbage. Also, the whole sequence about the "angel of justice" left me completely confused.The characters were half formed, flat, cardboard cutouts. None of them had any depth. None of the emotions they portrayed were believable. Some little things I noticed about them left me thinking, "What the heck?!" For example, in the first fight scene where Nic Cage's character attempts to defeat a group of thugs harassing a woman and her son, he jumps in, and instead of taking them out easily like he could have done, he stands there for ten minutes straight, swaying back and forth for no reason whatsoever. Then he starts fighting, and the thugs kick his butt way too easily. Later in the movie, he is facing a group of enemies again, and this time, he kills them all immediately with one swipe of his chain. How does this make any sense? I had no feelings of sympathy or understanding for any of the characters. It was one of those movies that I sat in, wishing that all of them would die in the end.The action scenes could have been exciting, but they weren't. Something was weird about them, like something was missing: like maybe some good motives for the characters fighting, or maybe a way to tell who was a good guy and who was a bad guy. Also, while the special effects improved from the last movie, there was still something quite unremarkable about the fiery explosions. Even now after thinking about it for a while, I still can't fully explain why everything about the action seemed so... lame.I thought the cinematography in Battle: Los Angeles was bad, but this movie just beat it by a lot. I could not make out what was happening in about 75% of the movie. The camera was jerking and shaking uncontrollably almost the entire time! Even in the more calmer scenes, the camera still moved around like we were supposed to expect something to happen suddenly. The characters jumped everywhere on the screen, with no regards to the laws of physics, or even reality. In one scene, Nic Cage and some other guy are fighting on top of a car. At one point, one of them flips the other one over, and the camera flies around with them, and somehow they both end up on the top of another car. I don't even know what happened! One last thing: the locations of the characters was unknown to me the entire time, and they jumped from place to place in every scene with no explanation of how they got there and why they went there in the first place.This has to be the worst movie I have seen to date. The only reason me, my brother, and his friend stayed the whole time was because I had paid $30 for our tickets. Although, even after staying for the whole movie, I still felt like my money was completely wasted. This movie is the worst thing ever. The "story," the characters, the action, the cinematography, EVERYTHING about this movie was terrible, and a complete waste of time. Do not see this movie. If you can believe it, Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance makes the famously crappy Batman and Robin look like movie-making genius.

This is the worst movie I have seen so far this year. The plot was boring, the scenes bad and the acting just poor. N. Cage is no longer the same actor he was back then but that is besides the point. I hate it when he tries to explain certain acts in the film where they pause the movie and you are shown some silly flash back. The worst was when the rotting man was attacking; everything was paused and it looked like a cartoon. I would never have seen this movie if I had to pay for it, luckily I watch films for free (I pay a monthly fee). Would I recommend you watch it? No. There are good scenes which you see on the trailer and those occur in the first thirty minutes of the movie. The Producer could have done much better but I guess it is part of the trick where all crap movies are in 3D.

reviews.review_title: I wasn't expecting much and it still let me down..
reviews.content: In short this movie's plot was about as in depth as a children's bedtime story, the character development was non-existent and most of the dialog was hokey and repetitive. The 3D and effects were good enough, but it seemed like everything else was an afterthought. I wasn't expecting much from this movie and it still let me down. I was surprised that Marvel would let a movie with their backing go so wrong. Half way through the show I wanted to walk out.. If I were alone I would have. It motivated me to open an IMDb account just so I could review it and warn you guys, it was the worst movie I've seen in years!! Hope you save yourself your hard earned money on this one.

I enjoyed watching 1st part in my childhood and was interested in the sequel but the sequel was bad. Movie's story, writing, acting, action, direction, everything was bad. Only thing that was in the movie was no brainer entertainment which I enjoyed. Overall, it is a no brainer entertainment.

How can they even call this movie a Ghost Rider. Its a disgrace for that name. I mean idea itself is not so bad as the most of the actors in this so called movie. And I wonder why they did not kept old classy Devil. Peter Fonda was way better then this guy , combat scenes are really stupid Johny Blaze should fight with his fists not with constriction machines. And the last but not the least in fact de facto most lamest thing of them all Ghost Rider is not riding Chopper where is goddamn chopper here HOW THE HELL IS DAMN GHOST RIDER NOT RIDING CHOPPER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!????????????????? I gave this movie 6 because of two things. First of them is that movie is hilarious it makes me laf and because of Irdis Elba , Morau the Franch he was the only man in entire cast who did his job good!!!

This is my first review and I am doing it to spare others from spending their time and money on this stinker. I loved the first one. It was light, fast, and a bit kitschy like the old batman series. The graphics was done well and it all moved smoothly and quickly to a fun conclusion.This last movie was so bad I don't know where to start. The ghost rider went from glib quick action super hero to twitchy slow moving zombie. The bike which I loved in the first movie was dumped for a a simple stock speed bucket Harley. They added fire animations around the wheels and at the back.It was a pitiful effort. The Bad guy looked like a regular Joe who had lost a fight with a bag of flour. Think of the old movie "Powder". The movie itself looked like a mock up rather than a real movie. It was cheap, clipped and impossible to find a story in it. I gave it a score of 1 because I would pay the movie price all over again if I could just have that time back.

reviews.review_title: If you liked the first one do not watched this one
reviews.content: Useless. Completely useless. I cant find words to describe my disappointment! I was expecting so much. The first one was really good, especially the parts where Nicholas Cage transforms into the rider. This new one is dumb. Nicholas Cage looks like a buffoon. The ghost riders cool look and walk have been replaced by a "drunken man" style of walking. His bike awful. His skulls looks like... well you cant see his skull anymore because it is covered by smoke. Oh by the way he can teleport! Oh wait. If he can teleport why does he need that stupid bike? He is also invulnerable to bullets and Heat seeking missiles but can be hurt by a grenade! Crazy! Stupid. The story makes no sense. Cage's acting is just bearable. The rest are an eyesore.All taken in DO NOT WATCH IT. I wish these idiotic directors would do a bit of research before they started to make a movie.

reviews.review_title: An action movie lacking excitement. How is this even possible?
reviews.content: The main character is Johnny Blaze, who has made a deal with Satan himself to become Ghost Rider, an indestructible body of bone and hellfire. Doesn't seem like this man has anything that can stand in his way, now does it?And so it is. Ghost Rider picks his enemies apart with such ease that it's almost laughable. The only limitation to his powers seems to be that he can not scorch each and everyone of his opponents immediately, so some shouting and waving of the flaming bike chain must be involved (cue constant cgi).The lack of real obstacles, outside the obvious time and space, of course, leads to another deficit, and that's a lack of excitement in this film. At no point is Ghost Rider's success under any credible threat. Maybe he might eventually get bored with all the fire being summoned and sinners being scorched that he'll just say "to hell with all this" and quits? I know I was close to that point with this film.As the filmmakers realized that demonic possessions creating violence is not enough of an excuse to make a movie, they decided that demonic possession may also create drama. I completely understand that being possessed by something originating from the depths of hell can be a real drag and may drive a man in to deep depression, yet it's a bit hard for the average viewer to relate with the internal struggles of a stunt biker who keeps turning into a fiery and inextinguishable spirit of vengeance to fight Satan.This film is just flashing images and loud sounds. Beyond that there's only void.Avoid.

reviews.review_title: Worst Sequel I have ever seen...
reviews.content: I wish I could give this movie a rating of "0", because that's what it deserves. I loved the first "Ghost Rider". Many people didn't like it but I thought it was very well done.I saw "Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance", thinking that it would continue where "Ghost Rider" left off. I was completely lost for most of "Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance". I only understood the plot when I read it on IMDb, after seeing the movie. Mephistopheles does not appear in this film. It's not Peter Fonda, but some fat older guy, representing the devil. The way Johnny made the deal is a lot different and more stupid. In this movie, Blaze made the deal by smashing a vile with his fist, and then by spraying a stream of blood on the contract. The biggest problem for me, however, was the fact that they ruined the Ghost Rider himself. This new Ghost Rider LOOKED cool but the Ghost Rider acts like some insane mental case that just escaped from an asylum. Instead of saying "look into my eyes" to his victim (killing him minutes later, after the victim has seen all the evil they've done), like in the first "Ghost Rider", the new Ghost Rider stares at his victim for 5 boring minutes. Then after shaking his head around like he's being annoyed by a swarm of bees, the victim screams and then just falls to the ground. On top of all of this, the director had $75 Million to work with! Are you kidding me? This guy had more money than Steven Spielberg had to make "Saving Private Ryan". The directors, Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylor, and the writers, Scott M. Gimple (screenplay) and Seth Hoffman suck, in my opinion. The only good thing about this movie is a few cool special effects and Nicholas Cage. However, he only does a bad job as his character because the writers gave him nothing to work with. I will never watch any movie, in future, if it is written or directed by the people listed above. In my opinion if you have a huge load of money to make a movie, and you can't make it a good movie, then DON"T MAKE IT! If you saw "Ghost Rider" and think that this movie will also be good because you were fooled by the trailer, DO NOT GO SEE THIS MOVIE! I cannot describe the disappointment you will receive. For me, this movie, "Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance", was the worst sequel I have ever seen.

reviews.review_title: Horrible Sequel to A Great Movie
reviews.content: This movie did nothing for me. It's not something I would buy or even rent! It had nothing to do with the previous movie and the cartoon/anime drawing in among the rest of the movie just made it that much worse. They changed how Johnny had signed his contract with the devil, they changed the character of the devil, not to a better actor but a worse one. Then they place it like Johnny is in solitude because he can't handle being the rider but when we left him on the previous movie it seemed he was going to do some good with his new found alter ego, embrace it. To me it was so disappointing...and to have put it in 3D, the effects would've been worth while if they had remotely stuck to ANY story line. If you haven't watched the first one then don't worry, this is really it's own movie but made so horribly.

Fortunately for "Ghost Rider: Spirit Of Vengeance" IMDb doesn't offer negative ratings, else its definitely got a minus rating. I'm a big fan of Marvel movies & a superhero movie fan too, but this one is utter crap. The first Ghost Rider movie wasn't that impressive, but was still a one- time watch for the effects & action sequences with decent acting.Sincerely request Mark Neveldine & Brian Taylor, please don't inflict such torture on the audience again - never never in any of your lifetimes or in any of the parallel universes. What were you guys planning to deliver anyways - Was it something with total senseless direction, Pathetic acting, weird editing with ridiculous action scenes.

reviews.review_title: Not even worth watching on TV when it comes out
reviews.content: Ghostrider2 is to say the least terrible. Mark Steven Johnson did an absolute wonderful job writing and directing the original Ghostrider whereas Mark Neveldine the director for GR2 and Scott Gimple the writer produced a flop. The original storyline is not maintained and the low budget of the film showed thru with poor CGI effects and the 3D was totally lost and useless. The loss of the Rider persona and the Bike he rode destroyed the flavor of the movie from the very beginning. Nicholas Cage's performance in the original was amazing whereas his performance in GR2 can hardly be described as acting. This movie had such great potential and had Mark Steven Johnson been involved it could have achieved that potential.

reviews.review_title: Not worthy. Don't waste your time and money
reviews.content: When I knew that there was going to be a second Ghost Rider movie I really expected to be better than the first one. Now I realize that I was completely wrong and I feel so disappointed. The movie is a completely waste of time, with a lack of content and story. Although the CGI and the FX are really good, they depend and abuse on them. What can I say about the cast. Nicolas Cage is definitely awful, the only thing he does is laugh and scream all his lines. Violante Placido's performance was really weak, Ciaran Hinds as Roark is way overacted, maybe the only good performance was the one of Fergus Riordan as Danny. In conclusion, if you are one of the people that thought the first one was bad (not including me) well I recommend you not to go and watch this one and if you still want to watch it well, it's under your own risk.

Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance. New skull. Nicolas Cage showed the height of insanity. And if in the first film his Racer was a harsh creature, now he is a psycho on wheels. Very crumpled plot and everything happens "because because". But very well filmed and the new image of the Racer is very cool!

Where to start...Cage's gravely overacted performance is almost as bad as in 'Drive Anry'. Some scenes are so ridiculous it makes you squirm in your seat. I can't believe this is the same guy who did 'Lord of War' or 'Wild at Heart'. Maybe it's a badly copied clone. The director's who's shaky style worked for the Crank series just make this look messy. There are also some daft errors: in the beginning of the film bullets and a rocket send Rider to the hospital and later he can take loads of them without a scratch. Maybe the only good thing about this movie is that the burning skull looks like it's more realistically on fire then in the first one. Thx poor VFX guys who had to work on this crap.

When I first heard they were making a sequel to the first Ghost Rider film, I have to say that I really had no interest in seeing it at all after the first installment. Then I heard the directors from Crank would be directing the film and it gave me hope that the movie might actually be good. I then saw the first trailer and I suddenly became excited! The special effects looked better, the tone was darker, and the action looked bad-ass! I was all the sudden on board with the film and even if it wasn't that great, I figured there was no way they could make a film as bad as the last one.Sadly, I was wrong.Now let me get something clear: While I did enjoy watching this one more, I can't really call it a better film. Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance in some ways is actually worse than the first film. But, some things in it are also better.The action for example, is for the most part better in this installment. There's a lot more of it than the last film and when it is going on, it's pretty bad-ass. However, some of the action (espicaly early on in the film) is actually really slowed paced and frustrating to watch. The trailer also gives away many of the good action shots so there's not a whole lot of cool action in here that you haven't already seen in the trailers. The effects here (espicaly Ghost Rider himself) actually don't look that bad and fit the tone of the film well and the soundtrack sounds incredibly bad-ass! Sadly, thats all the good stuff I can really say about this film. The plot here which involves Johnny trying to save a young boy from the devil is horrible! I didn't mind the cheesy plot at first, but the film invest way too much time into what already is a horrible story when it should've been focusing on action. Going into this, I actually wanted the film to be cheesy, but it gets to the point where the film is no longer cheesy and just plain bad. The acting is awful and Nicolas Cage's performance is so awful that it's unintentionally hilarious although he does have a few good moments where he goes over-the-top. The dialogue is absolutely atrocious and is easily some of the worst i've heard in a long time. I couldn't believe how bad some of the lines in this movie were. The editing and camera-work is also done very poorly here and gives the film a sloppy messy feel to it that it does not need. The film also just stops instead of having a real ending to it similar to the way Transformers 3 ends.I really tried hard to enjoy this film but I just couldn't. I am rating it a bit higher than I should though because the film did make for a fun time since I spent most of it laughing at how bad it was. But, there were small things in it that I did enjoy. Still, Spirit of Vengeance is only slightly better than the first film and in many ways even worse than it. Those looking for an over-the-top stupid action movie will be let down by the lack of action the film has at some points and the sloppy filmmaking. Not even the Crank boys could save this one.

Going into seeing Ghost Rider I did not have much expectations for this film. I thought the first Ghost Rider film was OK, not great nor bad either. So at the very least I felt that this film would possibly be like the first Ghost Rider film in that regard. I was actually quite wrong.If fact, I came out of this film feeling that this film made the first Ghost Rider film look like a good movie.Spirit of Vengeance is very confusing. That was the main issue for me. I had very little idea just what was going on and was lost pretty quickly. The story was old and boring and did not do anything to make me feel like caring about the film or any of the characters in it.Nicolas Cage is annoying as Johny Blaze again, I think probably not as annoying as in the first film but pretty close. Its hard for me to get into a film with a protagonist who is not someone that I can cheer for.I did like the look for Ghost Rider tho. He looked pretty cool. A few of the action scenes are OK too. But I don't think that it did nearly enough to make this movie one that I can recommend seeing. So I do not recommend this film.

reviews.review_title: How could it be WORSE than the first...
reviews.content: Ghost Rider: Spirit Of Vengeance It's really not a good sign when the trailers you've seen multiple times are more entertaining than the following feature.________________________ Having seen the first movie, I honestly didn't have much hope for this, and thanks to that because I would have bee let down had any expectation been present.I started not liking this movie about 10 minutes into it. The opening of the movie there is a man on a motorcycle (Moreau) riding up to some secluded castle in Europe. Arrives, takes off his helmet and starts talking to a group of priests, talking about this 'boy' and how he needs to be protected until the solstice is over... The priest says, "The boy is safe here..."this is a fortress"... Seconds later a group of 12 thugs with machine guns overrun the place, the boy and the mother (where did the mother come from?) flee in a small car.At this time, I almost thought 'what movie am I watching? Then an animated credits came up, with Nic Cage voice over "Deal with the devil, demon powers etc..." ________________________ It intros Johnny Blaze, hiding in foreign countries, running from the hunger inside (basically like Ed Norton in The Incredible Hulk). He is tracked down by Monroe, the drunk french priest and told that he is meant to save the same boy from the opening. Johnny doesn't buy it but the man says he can take his curse away.So that night Johnny Lets his guard down and unleashes the rider. Being able to 'sense' the boy (doesn't explain the up front) he finds the boy and mother trapped by the same thugs whom have been following them for days and just seemed to think "hmm days later, at night, that is when we should then take the boy back" FINALLY, you actually see the rider do something, he rides in, flying overhead lands past them. Baddass'ery and all turns around, flaming head, jacket bubbling, chains in hand ready to take somebody out...Then it just stands there for 2 minutes, the terrible monotonous guitar riff's over and over. I was confused, the bad guys seemed confused, everyone just kept looking at each other. Then finally like butter, the rider slashes his chain through two baddies, machine gun fire! The Rider spits the bullets right back at him in a fiery blast.Then the most metro, non threatening mercenary ever grabs a grenade launcher and blasts the Rider.Then Johnny Blaze is escaping from the hospital and going to continue this pursuit. WAIT WHAT?!? He is on fire, eats souls and has no flesh but an explosion takes him out?...________________________ What else bothered me...***Spoilers*** You find out this mother protecting this kid also made a deal with the devil (Rourke) and the son is the product of that deal. It does not out how, just a two second flash back of the devil seeing her dying from a fall and saying "looks like you could use some help". Was the baby (who is now a teenager in the movie) immaculately conceived? Did he rapidly grow and age, because the lady who made the deal was not thirteen years younger.The main thug (Carrington) later shoots a freaking missile at the Rider and that seems to have no effect. In the ensuing fight, dies did NOT make any deal with the devil, dies, and then is brought back and given the power to decay things? No dramatic scene, coughing up blood, struggling to breathe "You can't let me die, you need me!" scene where the devil walks up all suave and calls him a maggot and such... They didn't even refer to the enemy as 'pestilence' or anything in the movie.The dialogue! Oh my goodness the dialogue. The handful of terrible one liners, awkward pauses and empty and childish insults from everyone does the audience and the characters no credit.They introduced Christopher Lambert as a character, immediately killing him.The Rider kept on staring his victims down face to face screening and nothing happens... no face melting, no soul stealing, then they might die in a bit...________________________ And really... the Devil seemed to be useless the whole movie, didn't threaten anyone, didn't do anything, barely was in it. The Devil was kind of a bitch.If you loved the first one... you will still hate this.DON'T Watch this.****************************** Update! : EVERY, no exaggeration, every shot from this movie was from the viewpoint of a child.Example: Rider walking 6 feet? - Camera @ feet pointed up Dialogue and people just talking? - Camera at crotch level pointed up Motorcycle moving or car chase? - Up It is like the entire crew had fanny pack camera for the entire shoot!!!

The starts with a very shitty narration that I had heard in my whole life. I already knew that the film is bad but since I had seen the first part and also because I believe sometimes we should bring us down by watching bad stuff. To begin about the film I say that everything in the film is bad. I am not an expert in films but even then I could notice the poor CGI. Next I would want to ask the directors –"Who was the villain?". Our Hero is laughable. He was portrayed in the first part better (Atleast I think so.). The most irrational part came when he laughed. I mean should we or any other fear him or not? He is in fist fight with human beings(How ridiculous.). The female role was also worthless and seemed to be of no importance. I wonder what has happened to Nicolas cage. Now coming to the story, it was the worst story I had seen in the recent times. I could keep on going writing about this film(But usually I don't have points to tell about films.). Better I should stop telling the verdict."A definite NO to anyone unless you are a fool like me to watch it just because of the first part."

Okay, let's make this clear, this is NOT a sequel. I saw this movie on blu-ray, and the director said it was a reboot(what a stupid idea). And, yes, this movie is stupidly awful. At least, take it seriously a bit, but no, they didn't it was a horrible joke of a film. Stupid, tough to follow, plot, okay performances, cool action, horrible writing, cheesy as "hell", the movie was overall short but felt so much long... It was a mindless mess. If you want a Ghost Rider movie, watch the first one! Its not a masterpiece but it's better than this trash. Please don't waste your time on this. By the way, Jerry Springer is ,indeed, the Devil so it deserves one star out of ten!

Are you familiar with the song Crash and Burn by Savage Garden? The song ideally discusses a theme of togetherness for good or for bad come what may. Nicolas Cage did not learn the first time with GHOST RIDER back in 2007 although co –star Eva Mendez did. Instead, the action-hero (of the yester years) is adamant of going up in fire by playing Johnny Blaze the 2nd time round. It is hard to watch someone you are a fan of fail isn't it? Since of late it is without a doubt that Nicolas Cage fans are feeling this. 2011 is not one of the best years of his career and the curtain raiser for 2012 seems to have crash and burned as well. Gone are the days where wise choices are being made it seems, it's as if the economic crisis is effecting the big names of Hollywood. Someone or the other seems to be picking up lousy scripts putting in a few bucks into it and trying to earn some fast cash. How successful that plan worked out to be is obvious on the box office maps of GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE.What exactly went wrong this time round? The answer is simple and it isn't rocket science. The marvel comic Ghost Rider is considered the most supernatural hero of all. Now it is understood that movie industry is massive and is a great way to mint money (Ask Robert Downey Jr), however when you make a movie which ideally should be rated by MPAA as R in the format of PG 13 it destroys the entire concept of the comic. In simple terms it absolutely castrates the GHOST RIDER. Mark Neveldine (Jonah Hex, Gamer) and Brian Taylor (Gamer, Crank) are known for making movies that hit rock bottom. Either they clearly lack the vision of what a good script is or somewhere down the line they overstretch the creativity making movies that should be categorized as time wasters. Not even the acting is able save GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE. Nicolas Cage and Ben Affleck need to steer clear of superhero movies; it clearly isn't there strong suite. Idris Elba does some justice to his portrayal of Moreau and so does Ciaran Hinds with Roarke while the others merely falter at every stage to connect with the audience. Poor direction, below average characterization, CGI which is putrid GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE indeed my number one flop hit of 2012 thus far.Johnny Blaze returns after 5 years of running from the darkness that lives inside him. Johnny Blaze who sold his soul to the devil as a youngster is haunted by The Rider. Elsewhere in Eastern Europe, Danny and his mother Nadya are being hunted down by a group of assassins. Ray who leads the group of assassins is hired by the dark lord himself to capture Danny. It seems that the dark lord has some interest in the youngster much like he had with Johnny. A lone ranger (Moreau) who is on a mission to protect Danny needs the help of the Rider, but can they dark rider find in him some element of kindness to something good for a change? The synopsis alone sounds horrible to me; fear not the movie lives up to this in every aspect.SKIP THIS ONE!TITLE: GHOST RIDER: SPIRIT OF VENGEANCE. DIRECTED BY: MARK NEVELDINE AND BRIAN TAYLOR STARRING: NICOLAS CAGE,VIOLANTE PIACIDO, CIARAN HINDS, IDRIS ELBA, JOHNNY WHITWORTH & FERGUS RIODAN RATED: PG 13 RATING: 02/10 95 MINUTES

The movie is just horrible. But I would just like to point out a couple of things. The first couple of minutes is probably the best part of the whole film. The first thing to notice about the beginning is that I didn't know I was watching "The Matrix" when Idris Elba jumped off his bike and froze time to shoot at the enemy's suv. When you go further into the film, you realize there is a lot of skipped information which made the movie very hard to follow. Many people seemed to already cover this so I will be brief. THE MOTIVE WAS TO GET THE KID. Ghost Rider goes and stares down some randoms for like 2 minutes and forgot what he was looking for. Lets the enemy escape (obviously).You will notice that the guy behind it all is suppose to be a big all mighty powerful demon but he does nothing throughout the film that shows that; all talk basically. He acted like a big sack of potatoes. He gives power to Ray but the power makes no sense. It seemed like he can't control it (i.e the apple and sandwich scene) but something with a wrapper on it makes it all good? There is just too much things in this movie that made no sense.The ending has to be the worst of them all. Not many people commented on this (im guessing because they'd had left the theatre before it ended). Cage apparently released the GOOD side to the demon-----question is how? What? He all of the sudden could control the demon? Or am I forgetting that in both Ghost rider films, they made it clear the demon is too powerful to control, ever!!!!

reviews.review_title: I Just Want My Money Back!
reviews.content: "The Rider gonna come out. And when he does, he'll destroy whoever's got it coming". Yeahh, you're right! It destroys everything in its path! From now on, whenever you hear the words "Ghost Rider", the first thing that comes to your mind it will be a veryy baddd movie! They definitely don't have enough good basic material to build a reasonable movie in the first place, thiz is for the second time! The first "Ghost Rider" in 2007 was one of the ugliest superhero movies ever made. Anyway, I have my respect for the Directors Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylor. Generally, I like their works especially the stylish camera angle and color structure. A little bit rough, energetic and sometimes comical with fast moving scenes exactly like they have shown in "Crank" (2006) and "Gamer" (2009). But that's certainly not enough. Thiz time, Johnny Blaze (Nicolas Cage), the alter-ego of Ghost Rider has to protect a child from The Devil in human form upon the request of a monk named Moreau (Idris Elba). The storyline is obviously weak in all aspects. They tell a simple story in long and boring 90+ minutes. Furthermore, the setting is told in Europe. Hello... where is the Europe? I don't see Europe! All I see is desert and rocky mountain in the middle of nowhere. After all, the Ghost Rider's character is originally dark and mysterious. That atmosphere is clearly not shown here. They are using too much sick humor and too much clear blue sky, if you know what I mean. It comes to my mind, it would be totally different if they hire the Director who knows how to make a convincing shade of dark Gothic like Tim Burton or Guillermo del Toro. The next thing is Nicolas Cage. I don't know what actually happens to Cage, he obviously tries to look cool with his cheesy one-liner dialogue. Furthermore, at some scenes when Blaze struggles to hold back the demon inside him to come out, he creates a very strange and amusing expression. The rest of the Cast members deliver B-Class performance such as Idris Elba, Violante Placido, Johnny Whitworth, Christopher Lambert and even the child Fergus Riordan. The Devil once said to Johnny Blaze, "You were the worst frickin' deal I ever made". well, I have my complaint too, I just want my money back! Visit My Blog on JONNY'S MOVEE : http://jonnyfendi.blogspot.com

I really liked Ghost Rider movie that came out 2007, despite the movie being cheesy and feeling like a low budget movie, I liked the story plot of that movie.When I saw this movie Ghost Rider Spirit of Vengeance trailer at the cinema, I knew it would be an underwhelming movie from the impression trailer. Now I finally watched it and it saddens me that the movie disappoints.This time the movie production studio had bigger budget than last time. But sadly the budget was spent on the giant drilling machine and vfx of Ghost Rider.Characters are not so great, Nicolas Cage reprises the role of Johnny Blaze and while he is ok as the actor, he kinda lost that soulless Johnny Blaze from the first movie. Idris Elba was not convincing because of the fake accent he uses, which also disappears half the time. Other characters were lacklusters.The story feels like a retelling of the original Ghost Rider movie as different scenes were used for the backstory filler. And the scenes they used looked so low budget! First movie made sense because he didn't intend to sign the contract.The biggest grip I hated about this movie were:
1) stupid Ghost Rider character. In this movie, he was shown more of a terror character rather than a badass character from first movie. The way he jerky moves, or spins after being hit by a javalin missile was so STUPID. I understand the director having a cool vision for Ghost Rider to look scary and cool at the same time, but those things just appeals to children.Also chains coming out of his mouth, guns firing into his mouth. Nothing makes NO sense! Also you wonder if Ghost Rider can even get hurt. In the first movie they made a mistake by allowing Johnny Blaze to be hurt after he was stabbed on his shoulder as Ghost Rider. In this movie they did the same stupid mistake! Can Ghost Rider be hurt or not???2) the stupid exposure effects. A scene where they visited the monks, they used too much bloom effect that the location just felt too fantasy. It had too much bloom effect!Also why is it every damn time the Decay demon uses his power, there is always a dark exposure to the visual scene? That sh* was so damn annoying and pointless!!!3) also why did the made Ghost Rider spirit as an angel? Angel cast down but corrupted by ways of the world. Yet in the first movie the Care Taker was living in the western time and not modern city. So how could the ghost rider be corrupted by clubbing, drugs, anarchy etc shown in that flash back?In the first movie, whenever Ghost Rider does the penance stare, you can see a nice effect. In this movie, there is nothing happening, you are totally unaware he is even doing the penance stare. Like I said, vfx budget went towards making Ghost Rider look realistic.The movie had weak action, nothing that wows you, the music were lackluster. I really love the jail scene in first Ghost Rider movie, that music and jacket scene was so badass. This movie touched nothing like that, peeing Flamethrower was stupid.I think if this movie was rated R or 18, it could be good. The movie started off very good like a nice action movie but shortly after the first encounter with Ghost Rider, the movie fell short and boring.Final scene with devil Roarke, why the hell is he even called that??? His damn name is Mephisto or Mephistophilis! Anyway that fight was so damn underwhelming!!!It is such a shame the movie is disappointing. Marvel would stay AWAY from Ghost Rider ip for quite some time until people miss him, or demand for him or simply forget him.

A few years back I saw my first scary face video on youtube. I never thought they would still pull off movies based on that. GR is wearing a plain leather jacket, no spikes, no chain wrap around his body, no white skull. They even changed the flames colour to neon blue at some point.GR doesn't have a penance stare any more and nothing happens to his victims when he stares at them (?). Also I noticed a couple of out of sync sound/visual scenes in there somewhere.GR has a black charcoal skull which is not bad it kinda fits in with the black smoke and flames profile they have given to the new GR.GR scary faces while in trans mode are really funny and Cage is over acting the crazy guy changing into a flaming monster character. All scenes are very complicated and give the movie a visual boost but not any atmosphere.GR rides a Yamaha and not the classic US custom bike. The bike looks good I wonder what will they choose for the next bike, I hope not the same Yamaha model.There is no big boss final battle, GR is just throwing his creator into a hellfire hole with the help of a possessed kid. And that's it. What happened to all the colorful enemies GR has in the comic books ??Overall I'm getting the B-Movie feeling all over this and the Christopher Lambert appearance at the end destroyed it. I thought I was watching another Highlander TV show or something.I hope they choose another actor for GR next time and just try to put some kind of atmosphere in there without all these computer fake scenes. GR movies need a good photography concept and sound to get noticed by the old fans like the frank miller movies. Otherwise it is just a match between who makes the best cgi movies.

I was sadly disappointed with this film, granted the first one was modest I was expecting the second film to blow my mind away. It was horrific. No actual plot, or a weak one at that. The acting was beyond poor. The metamorphosis, was ridiculous. I could understand the struggle he was having within, as the GR, but seriously, save your money people. I was expecting a grand action series, which unfortunately never came. I admire Nick cage for his roles, but this one film really puts him to shame. I follow Marvel, and I believe by far, this is their biggest disappointment. So much emphasis and focus is being place on the CG, but the story is being lost. I love the fire bending ways, but seriously where is the story. I think anyone who makes these films should look at the comic book and see what it carries and bring some of that into the film.

extremely disappointed with the movie and in last 2 years of movie watching its the worst and painful...i wasted my money and i would suggest best forget the release as most of us here will regret.film looked more of comedy than horror and Nikolas cage looked tired and aging.story line remains the weakest link and old age villain looked more of a helpless guy than someone who should look cruel and powerful.don't watch.its a ?don't know what to say...

reviews.review_title: Yet again the screen writers took far too many liberties.
reviews.content: It is bad enough when movies are rehashed, or even if it happens to be the 4Th, 5Th, 6Th, etc. installment, but when they mess with the original plot is truly disgraceful. Shameful that no movie based off comic book super heroes ever follows the plot. Total twisting of how pact with the devil transpired. Young Johnny Blaze was ignorant of what he was doing, thought it was a joke. Johnny punctured his finger on sharp edge of contract scroll, dripped blood onto scroll at which point devil said that will do just fine. Rider in original movie had pearl white bone (skull, and hand bones), bright orange flames enshrouded him, clothes were clean. Image of Rider in Spirit Of Vengeance looked like he was covered in grease, ash and soot. Other than converting back to his human form and losing his Ghost Rider powers in sun light in Ghost Rider the Rider had no weakness in Spirit Of Vengeance major whuss. In Ghost Rider he easily held his own against Blackheart and the Fallen. Blackheart was created in hell and the Rider still easily beat him. What was with his Pennance Stare it was far more impressive in Ghost Rider. He was getting his butt kicked by the transformed Carrigan, I think Carrigan finally fell to the stare, which by the way metal and glass are not subject to decomposition, corrosion, rust, being melted into slag, but not rotting, yet another error on the part of the screen writers. In Ghost Rider Johnny had to voluntarily give up the hellfire he was possessed with, and no 1 could control him but in Spirit Of Vengeance Danny was was able to keep the Rider from using his powers.

The first of Ghost Rider is alright but it still lost its touch on the script writing. However this film is suppose to be a re-vamped version of the film because that how i got the impression from this film because the cgi is very disgusting it makes me want to vomit every time I see the cgi because it was so god awful. I have to sit there in my seat just waiting for something interesting to happen. But like the first film, this film flawed even worst because the all the acts were really boring out of my mind that this film drain the life out of me. This movie is very sad because it never make any logical sense. And that phone call between with the devil. That method of filming is the worst because the film just feels like an awful old school editing film that it was edited by iMovie once and never checked to see after a few times that the film is actually boring.

From the years I've watched many movies and I like a lot, although they were not really good one in rating, but still my tolerance for crappy movies is pretty high. This one however sets the bar so high for crappy movies, that you will not be able to see it with binoculars in a launched space shuttle!I tried, I reaaaaaally tried to see it from a certain aspect in which it would appear pleasing, but I could not find one. Everything in it is done awfully bad, to the point of vomit at place.If by any chance you gave something more than 1 hour and 30 minutes time, you should ask for a refundRating: Unholy Awful crap

reviews.review_title: Great Marvel character destroyed with this movie
reviews.content: To be quite honest, I was somehow surprised when I saw the reviews of Ghost Rider (2007). Rating of only 5.2 was quite low, concerning it was a pretty good movie. I liked everything about it (acting, story, effects) and it was a refreshing movie to watch.However, Spirit of Vengeance was a total disappointment. When I first saw the trailer, I was a bit disapproving about the black skull instead of white and the changes made on the Rider's bike, but somehow I got over it. Trailer looked promising to me, but when I finally got to watch the movie I was hit in the face with bad acting, poor story-telling and stupid jokes. The movie lost it's darkness and the action scenes were so exaggerated that they lost any common sense. There are no words to explain how bad this movie is and I must admit that I'm sorry they ever made it. I almost walked away from the cinema and I don't do that that often. In fact, I remember only two movies I stopped watching before the ending.If Hollywood ever decides to make a Ghost Rider 3, I hope they return to direction the first one was going. Because it had the right emotion, serious story, great acting and most of all... breath-taking Rider's first transformation. Furthermore, Peter Fonda's incarnation of the Devil was so dark and demonic, in one word "awsome".To conclude, do NOT waste your time on this movie, because it's simply AWFUL.

Ghost Rider Spirit of Vengeance is a truly awful movie, not only is it an embarrassment to this character that is featured in the title, but it is an embarrassment to the superhero genre as a whole. So, it is a ever so slight downgrade from its predecessor. Nicolas Cage reprises his role as Johnny Blaze in Ghost Rider Spirit of Vengeance. In this gritty new vision for the character, directed by Neveldine/Taylor (Crank), Johnny is still struggling with his curse as the devil's bounty hunter - but he may risk everything as he teams up with the leader of a group of rebel monks (Idris Elba) to save a young boy from the devil... and possibly rid himself of his curse forever. -- (Sony) The plot is that Johnny Blaze, played by Nicholas Cage, must protect a child from the devil and his forces. Sounds fun right? Well it is... for about 20 minutes. The rest of the film is complete dog crap. The plot is a nonsensical mess full of plot holes and outright stupid moments (In the end he turns into, basically the angel rider... I am serious). This script is poorly written and shows that whoever wrote it has no knowledge of the character, and the dialogue written is atrocious and unintentionally funny. The acting here is a slight improvement, but seeing as how the acting in the previous film was some of the worst ever shown in a superhero movie that isn't saying much. Nicholas Cage still looks like he's on meth throughout the whole thing, and everyone else is barely trying. The only positive I have is that the special effects look decent. Ghost Rider: Spirit Of Vengeance downright sucks. It is clear that it was meant to be campy fun, but that doesn't work with a character like this with an established history, and it ends up being utter poo because of it.

This. Movie. Was. Painful.I couldn't even finish it. I liked the first movie, I'll admit. It had its own charm and felt like a Marvel film. The first ten or so minutes of this was just boring, pointless and forgettable action scenes. Some of the shots filmed felt like they were there for the sake of being there. Like the part where Moreau crashed off of his bike and fell off of the road.Pointless crap. The story: completely uninteresting. Nicolas Cage in this movie acts silly, and isn't funny in the slightest. You can tell the writer of this movie wanted to get chuckles out of us, in what is meant to be a dark and serious Marvel film. Some scenes don't make sense. Everything seems to happen way too fast. One moment it's calm, the next we have a damn fight scene on our hands.I really didn't like what I saw of this film.

I do hope Nicholas Cage will do a 3rd Ghost Rider. I enjoyed the first and though many years later I just watched the 2nd. Make a 3rd and actually promote it more than this one, the 2nd. I am no one but I do strongly feel a 3rd would sky rocket if people actually knew about it sooner than 7 years after the release. Great job Mr. Cage and Claran Hinds!! You two were amazing as a team.

I am already one of the few people that actually doesn't think the first one was that bad. But this one is impossible to defend.The performances go from bad to mediocre. Nicholas Cage confirms again his downfall with another bad work and lots of overacting.The story makes no sense most of the time and every single character is uninteresting and bad developed.But the last straw is that even the action scenes are boring and the special effects are on a "direct to video" level, which is unacceptable for a $57 million dollar movie.If you really want to see the Ghost Rider again, rent the first one. Because this one can neither entertain nor scare anyone.
The first movie was awful. So is this one but the absolutely brilliant Neveldine/Taylor made this one visually stunning and it looks like they've been canceled.Thank you Hollywood.

reviews.review_title: For Cheese Loving Ghost Rider Fans Only
reviews.content: First off, let me admit I enjoyed the first Ghost Rider movie. A guy with a flaming skull dealing out justice? Nick Cage being....Nick Cage? It was a little campy, but it's a comic book movie about flaming skull demon biker guy. Anywho, they changed directors and the franchise went downhill (or bottomed out, depending what you thought of the first). A lot of reviewers claim a bad story, but having read thousands of comic books, it plays out to me like a 3-4 issue pretty normal Ghost Rider story arc. The pacing is a bit jerky, but the story is as coherent as this kind of tale can be. The acting however is remarkably terrible. Cage is a different level of manic that doesn't stay true to the Johnny Blaze character, either the one from the comics or from the previous film. The actor playing Satan wore this ridiculous grimace throughout. And then there was the actual filming: take a mix of art-house creativity, mix in a bajillion Red Bulls and some premium catnip and you still won't approach the mental mess that they called a finished product. This is far from the worst film I've seen, and I like some of the action scenes with the Rider, but overall I cannot recommend this film to anyone in particular. 3/10

I did not have high expectations because the New squad of directors given the task to the Sequel of a Very Good Ghost Rider are not who I would call consistent directors. They were creative with Crank and Gamer but not always a sure banger to deliver when Jonah Hex slapped us in the face. This movie is very very very bad, I found myself feeling sorry for the directors as most of the shots were taken from low profile so I would imagine the director would have to squat a lot to get the shots on a hand held camera. I DID NOT see any 3D in this movie or maybe I might have missed it. I believe the fire I saw for more than half an hour must have confused my brain,sorry. I believe I say honest things about movies and I understand what hard work the creators have done to achieve any form of media art but If this is the direction Mark Neveldine & Brian Taylor decide to take, then I'm afraid they will quickly disappear into oblivion. Archive this one as 'The wake up call' and go back to the drawing board to paint fans something beautiful next time. This movie was an Epic fail in every category of film. There was NO++ character development, continuity, satisfying action scenes, interesting dialogue, cleverly set stunt set-pieces and No story. I didn't care about any character in the movie and I was angry the film didn't end sooner. I hope they make a massive loss since I lost £40 after paying in 4 of my friends to such a sad disappointment.

reviews.review_title: One of my favorite comic book heroes gets defiled by Nicolas Cage.
reviews.content: Alright, here's another review. Ghost Rider 2: Spirit of Vengeance. After the below par first installment of this movie, I didn't have much hopes for this one. So special effects have increased obviously the past few years, and if you're looking for a bunch of fire, smoke, and dust, then by all means, see this movie. But if you're looking for acting, dialog, and up to speed fight scenes, you're out of luck. Nicolas Cage is...Nicolas Cage. I'm not too fond of him and this movie did not increase our relationship at all. Luckily, the child actor in the movie was not that much of an annoyance. The main girl was hot, and the main villain was okay at best. But Nicolas Cage should not have been this role. As is to come in many of Nicolas Cage movies, there's awkward emphasis on all of the wrong words that turns a serious situation to hilarity. And there is a scene where he shoots a flame thrower out if his dick. This film at best is sub-par. It's a mockery of Marvel Comics and to Ghost Rider, and it was not worth me staying up till two in the morning to watch. 5/10 at best. Try to see it for free. Don't pay for this movie.P.S. There was only one actual fight scene that lasted all of two minutes. This ended up SPOILER with the main villain dying. (Big surprise) The way in which his death was portrayed was horrible. The effects sucked and it looked like they forgot to add in his death and then made the animation in twenty minutes.

reviews.review_title: Incredibly CGI worth seeing if you like SFX great job
reviews.content: Very good movie and story line, great actors and incredible CGI. If you loved the first Ghost Rider well directed with good SFX well this is the one for you. I hope they make a third Ghost Rider. Enjoy

reviews.review_title: Worst movie you will ever see.
reviews.content: SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER I love ghost rider, one of my favorite comics growing up and a hero with a real case of good overcoming evil. The look of the ghost rider was perfect from they way he stood too his movements. now i know some people didn't like the burning up there soul thing from the stare of the ghost rider, but anyone that has seen SOV (spirit of vengeance)know the horrible way they changed the look. in one scene the ghost rider and the bad guy stare at each other while the rider just makes this goofy screaming sound. NOTHING happens they just stare for a good 2 minutes. i sat in the crowd waiting for some new cool looking effect to take place and show there on sins turned against them. instead there isn't any effects at all beyond the look of the rider. Hellfire which is what the rider is consumed of, which in the first movie they fire moved a lot and burned insanely, the new rider looks like a candle...a peaceful candle. I want to make some general points about films like this. We don't expect a great deal and we'll probably watch the next one. The problem with such films is balance between opposing forces. For much of the film the supernatural hero is up against a hard-working mercenary who gets a boosts later on. Everyone else just falls over. That reminds me of Ultraviolet, a great film for watching people fall over. For a lesson in balancing forces, look at the hastily made 1974 film Enter The Streetfighter where you have a hierarchy of powerful characters, much like Top Trumps, and all introduced quickly and without much effort. There are some good visuals in Spirit of Vengeance. We'd regard the special effects department more if the other parts of the film were functioning. I feel sorry for Ciaran Hinds who was once Julius Caesar, an actor. I don't feel sorry for Christopher Lambert. He won't be tarnished by his part. The mythology is not deep enough for this character. Were any comic book people engaged in the project? A far better film of this type is the 2005 film Man-Thing.

reviews.content:

But was far from enough.
