I felt this was not even B-movie, it was C-movie and i was wondering if it can be categorized as super-hero movie at all.I love super-hero movies and this felt like some kind of stupid ordinary garbage film you see frequently on TV, not in cinema and absolutely not a super-hero movie.The plot was joke, the action poor - and almost ALL of it, is found in the trailer.I hope the directors will be punished for at least 10 years of no movies by them.The last is the location, it was pretty evident by the locations how poor and cheap this movie was, next time don't shoot in Romania, shoot it in the USA again a REBOOT IT

As somebody who found the first Ghost Rider watchable at best, I was somewhat reserved for this one. Had it not been for promotional videos on YouTube describing how they were taking The Rider down a darker, more serious direction than the first film then I would have been inclined to give this one a miss. reviews.review_title: A Terribly Awful Film - Just like the first one
reviews.content: Overly dramatic with no substance and lacking in authenticity with regards to reactions to situations.The first intro to Ghost Rider is a perfect description: a slow cut/up pan is done - presumably to add to the sense of presence, though it fails utterly - then when we finally see him in full he does a Michael Jackson like fist to chest thump with one hand and the other in the air, while holding his chain.He did this in front of a group of "bad men" who are about to kill a lady and their child - and no one remarks about the flaming skull guy being...a flaming skull guy. Instead, the boss tells the guys to shoot Ghost Rider and for some reason Ghost Rider is unable to capture everyone or at least knock them down or kill them - because he wanted to concentrate what should have been his "Penance Stare" - when people feel the weight of their crimes - but instead is some form of soul sucking, and so the bad guys get away with the kid.Funny thing is, the kid is supposed to be the point of the Ghost Rider's search - so why did he essentially just stand there and watch everyone pile into a car and drive away with him? There's another point in the tale, earlier, where a "business man" finds the lady at a coffee shop somewhere...and because she's at a coffee shop he solicits her for sex...because any lady at a coffee shop is a prostitute.He took of his wedding ring as he noticed her staring, and then he asks her if she's a gypsy, because...he was leading to say gypsies are prostitutes.I'm not sure why people make awful films - Ghost Rider is actually a pretty great story, and it's already written and selling for about thirty years, now, so it's not like they couldn't have taken an episode from one of his comics if they so badly lack material - but this film is so awful I think an angel lost its' wings and there will be no Christmas for some because of it.So far, only the Iron Man and the Thor movies are anything like they should be, in comic world - and the Thor one was vandalized when they made up a love interest that wasn't the woman Thor has always had.I keep hoping Stan Lee will get mad and stop the madness...but, sadly, it has continued in a big way in this new ruin of a movie.I am struggling, in parting, to find some element that would be a "plus", some salvageable bit that would be an "at least..." to this tale...but there is none.

I can't believe it. Nicholas Cage has done it again. He's ruined another potentially good film.I believe that the Ghost Rider could make a fantastic movie. It has the right look and feel in the comics (and the more recent graphic novels) that would translate beautifully onto the big screen. But yet again, they chose to give the mantle to Nicholas Cage, and he has managed to overact the film into mediocrity and beyond.For me, I felt that every single scene where it was Cage speaking or appearing on screen was just further rubbish until the Rider appeared. This is the same thing as the last film, just limping along, staggering through Cage's overacted, hammy lines and poor attempts at conveying an emotion other than "cocky twit" until the Rider appeared for a few minutes and we get a genuinely good sequence. And then, just as we start to enjoy it, we're back to Cage again.Other than Cage, pretty much everything else about this film was wrong. What comic were they following? There are plenty of fantastic stories that a Ghost Rider film could use (Road to Redemption, Trail of Tears etc) but no, we had to get an "original" story which bored the pants off me.I am a big fan of Ciaran Hinds, I think that in the right role he can be brilliant, especially as a bad guy (I actually thought he was good in Tomb Raider 2) but here, as the devil...NO!!! Peter Fonda was perfect, he actually had the look of Mephisto, but no, we had to change it. Add to that instantly forgettable performances from everyone else and soon the only thing that you can remember when you walk out of the cinema is the urge to vomit every time Nicholas Cage tried to act.Or maybe that's just me?

First of, the first film isn't a cinematic masterpiece either, but at least it had something of a decent, easy to follow storyline, smoking hot Eva Mendes, and the always awesome Sam Elliot.If you haven't seen the first film, in a nutshell, Johnny Blaze sells his soul to the devil to save his father, but that all backfires as he is eventually summoned by the devil (who is much better in this one than in Vengeance), to carry out the duty of finishing off Blackheart and his elemental demon allies. He runs into his old high school flame (Mendes), has to protect her from the demons but fails, gains the help from an old mentor/fellow "Rider" played by Sam Elliot (who provides the best part of the film), goes off and defeats Blackheart. Once his duty is done, he is given the choice to get his soul back, but chooses to use his demon powers to try and stop the devil from doing evil around the world. Overall, not a terrible movie, acting can be hokey but can be enjoyable at times, and scenes with Ghost Rider himself are actually pretty impressive at times. For my money, 7/10.But as for it's long awaited sequel, Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance... just throws everything even remotely good about the first film and just replaces it all with bad writing, story, characters, and logic in realms of "Ghost Rider". I'll list off issues, first in the first film, the Ghost Rider only sought out to kill off the sinful on his own accord, but this one he'll be unleashed at the slightest presence of sin. And Blaze's character is now a paranoid, crazed man who cuts himself off from the world to keep the Rider at bay. And the rider himself, while his design is honestly good, isn't even nearly as cool as the first films version. The penance stare in the first film let you see all the sins of the sinner he is killing, and leaves their eyes looking like ashes. You don't even get that concept here, he just looks, roars, and they die. Wtf. About the only thing I liked in this sequel was his ability to make vehicles (including a crane and jeep) start flaming, but they don't undergo a bad-ass design change like his motorcycle in the first one (it looked all demonic skeletal while he rode it, but this one it just has flaming tires). And then, all the acting is either just has no/little effort put into it, or it just sucks overall. The overall concept of the story might have been a good premise, but it was so badly scripted that it just falls apart as you watch the film. One last thing, in the first film, the devil could not be touched by anybody, and here his ass get literally sent back to hell by the Rider (which is honestly the best scene in the film, but it just does not make sense if you even remember the first film.) All in all, the effects can be good, but promising concept destroyed by bad writing and crappy acting pretty much destroy this film as a whole for me. Maybe you'll enjoy it if you've already seen it but not the first one, but check out the original Ghost Rider, you might get something there you might like a lot more than this crap-fest.2/10 (and that's being nice).

reviews.review_title: Like The Ghost Rider himself: Soul Sucking
reviews.content: In 2007 we were given Ghost Rider, a superhero that has been widely considered to be one of the worst movies in the genre. I have not seen it mostly because I have not found it anywhere that I don't have to pay money for and if a superhero movie released in 2007 is considered worse then Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer then I don't think I could have the glimpse touch my eyes without opening my eyes out with tacks. I went into Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance with just about as little hype as I possibly could. I heard from many friends that this movie was bad so I decided to not see it in the movie theater, I watched on demand for free and hoped for a movie like Transformers where I could tell it was bad but I would enjoy it anyway. No, Ghost Rider 2 was nothing like that. I watched in awe at just how awful Ghost Rider 2 got. I cannot believe this movie was put out at all. The story is just silly. Johnny Blaze is hiding out in Eastern Europe and is called upon to stop the devil, who is trying to take human form. The form is that of a little kid, who just so happens to be his son. I do not understand how the devil could get any work done in transferring from a grown man to a bratty ten year old kid. Spirit of vengeance has exactly one good thing to it, Idris Elba. He actually looks like he is having fun but is obviously there just for a paycheck. Other then that the movie is just full of garbage. Not a SINGLE character is likable. The mother is annoying, the villains are some of the dumbest characters in film history, and the kid is quite possibly the worst kid in media since Carl from The Walking Dead. The camera shakes constantly almost as if they placed the camera on a paint mixer before rolling. Nicholas Cage overacts his lines to the nth degree. SOMEONE must have known that he was awful, I cannot imagine that anyone could possibly green light a performance like that. He is so bad I would almost recommend to watch it just to see him, but you can find the best parts on YouTube so there is no point. The editing is so bad as well. random scenes will just be cut into dialogue scenes especially one of Ghost Rider pissing fire. Also, they honestly expect you to buy the chemistry between this kid and Johnny Blaze. It could be the most awkward scene sharing in film history. Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance is the worst movie I have seen since Jack & Jill. NOTHING in this movie works except Elba and that is only because he is always fun. I cannot believe this movie was not stopped by production because it is honestly a top contender with Transformers 2 as worst action movie ever. I cannot recommend this movie to anyone even if you are in the mood for a bad movie. Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance is a worst superhero movie then Batman & Robin and is, without a doubt, the worst movie of 2012 so far.

Ghost Rider 2, in my opinion was a waste of my money to watch. If during a film I question why i am watching it, I know I should not be their. The style of the film is completely different to that of the first and relies almost entirely on special effects, even where they are not needed. There are many camera shots that are too short and quick for your brain to process what is in them and are therefore useless.The acting was moderate at best with Nicholas Cage doing his over the top acting and spoiling areas of the film. It is clear he is trying in this film, but way too hard! (And his cheesy lines, especially his last one, don't help!) The storyline however was OK and even though I had many questions as too why things didn't occur and I thought there were gaps in the plot, it kept me engaged at points, so much so that i did not leave the cinema.Overall I would suggest not going to watch it in the cinema (Especially in 3D, no point). Wait till it comes out on DVD and even then, borrow it from a friend or wait till it is only a few pound to buy.

reviews.review_title: At least I didn't have any expectations
reviews.content: The two words that best define this movie are "unnecessary" and "awkward".A sequel for a movie that was already considered bad? These little, cartoon-ish parts where you hear Nic Cage explaining everything about the movie? Unnecessary.Cage freaking out? Ridiculous one-liners by almost every single character? Awkward.It starts out fairly well, I must admit. That is, until a hot girl wearing makeup shows up. Wasn't she gonna fight the Devil himself? Who the hell needs makeup for that? Anyway. There's a boy that must be protected, for whatever reason. He's at this super fortress that's actually a church of some kind, I don't know. Lots of awful camera shots later, the "impenetrable fortress" is breached by a bunch of guys with guns. Alright.A while later, you see Nicolas Cage being asked by some french dude, whos called Moreau, to save that boy, who we see escaping the fortress with the hot girl with makeup. Turns out that the people who breached the fortress follow the two, and, as incompetent as every single villain in superhero movies are, they take so long to reach them, that, by the time they capture both, the Ghost Rider is already heading there. Now, I've read some stuff about him on Wikipedia, and apparently, he's one of the most powerful creatures in the whole world, of course something like a grenade launcher wouldn't stop him, right? Nope, it actually does. Later on, 2 Javelin missiles don't, but who cares anyway, right, Hollywood?OK, let's see. After that, there's some more meaningless action, with the most horrible camera work I've ever seen, and "witty" one-liners, like when the Rider throws a bad guy in front of a car and says "Roadkill". REALLY?Summarizing it all up: The humor shouldn't even be called humor in the first place; The effects are alright; The acting is ATROCIOUS; The actions scenes COULD have been good, but the camera and the lack of a steady pace makes them annoying (Not to mention, the Rider doesn't even find an enemy that stands any chance against him).Do NOT watch this

reviews.review_title: Ghost rider eats your soul and Money too !!!
reviews.content: About  Ghost Rider: spirit of vengeance -- The man on fire is back with his hell bike ... But, looks like he is just serving a barbecue treat  this time ;)I went to watch the film because of crank fame director duo Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylor. But they failed (including script writer) to translate marvel's characters on the screen :( .Though the length of the film is only 95 mins , you will get shattered on your seats... Haphazard action scenes, poor screenplay and mediocre  acting will defiantly disappoint you.Nicolas cage as Johnny blaze seems confused to understand his role..However, He is good as Ghost rider (because Ghost rider neither speaks nor expresses ...It's just technical ;) BTW digital makeover of Ghost rider is better than the last1. Idris Elba as Moreau is considerable.... All I can say about Italian beauty violante placido (Nadya) is Miss you Eva Mendes( Roxanne - Ghost rider2007) in this sequel To conclude : watch only if you have nothing better to do ...

Now don't get me wrong...The original Ghost Rider movie was camp,tongue in cheek and sometimes downright daft...But the big difference to that and this 2nd attempt...Was the first one WORKED..The first movie made no attempt to hide the fact that it was a "cheesy" Marvel comic movie.But it was great comic book stuff!! .This movie has nothing that holds a patch to the 1st one..The story is awful.(Same plot as countless others before it!),the acting atrocious and whoever directed poor Nick Cage to his latest rendition of the Rider should be shot (or at least fired!!). There is none of the charm of the first and seems to be made just for an attempt at trying out new effects..Sadly my wife just bought the DVD...But I am seriously thinking about returning it for a refund..This movie is THAT bad!!

I love the Marvel comic Ghost Rider, this movie is really something i want to forget. The music in this movie was terrible, the story was so and so, but the way this movie was shot was really awful!The character Jonny Blaze aka the Ghost Rider could be a cult movie but the director made a complete mess out of this one by using B movie technique from the first chapter on. The first Ghost Rider movie earned enough money to become a blockbuster so there is no reason to make a movie that have the look of a low budget sequel.The producers really need to get better directors if they are going to make a 3rd Ghost Rider movie.I send this one back to hell and the drawing board.

reviews.review_title: Nicholas Cage please stop making very bad films.
reviews.content: What shame. Poor Nicholas Cage. Why he make this film? First Ghost rider film was bad so why make worse one? Was that point, did he want to prove such things can be did? Say nice things first. Skull looked good. Now say bad things. Film was terrible. Ghost thing has magic powers but they never say what powers are so he just gets all of them. He too strong, it like watching sad fat kid play video games. He kills all the villains but then he goes home to cry and blame his mother. Film looked cheap like it was made in China to sell on local market. Actually is selling on local market but nobody is buying. Why do we care about character? He just silly man who looks too old now. He does silly faces and audience laughs but then uncomfortable. Not meant to be funny, we think of it. Is very bad. Everything to make it work is there. Comic book hero, guns, motorcycle (not scooter, don't think that works), cute girl (but she has kid so run away) magic and naughty villain who can't act good. But what go wrong in this? Everything! Comic book hero is really villain but hurts other villain so we say is alright. Hero not likable because Nicholas cage act like fool. He used to be cool, Con-air good, Raising Arizona good but now he makes this and still can't forgive for The Wicker man. He must need money. Gambling debts or something. Used to be cool actor, did action but have laughs. Now he just embarrass himself doing B-movies. Film very bad. I didn't enjoy. Big shame. When I heard they making 2 then I thought they must be clever. They must figure out how to make better film because first one was stink. No. Save money for crunchy seaweed.

The only reason i'm not saying this movie is awful is because they have used a V-Max in the movie which one of my favourite bikes. Well, people here told a lot about this movie but i wish to write it down anyway, Nicholas cage is a good actor when it comes to a good character but the main reason this movie is a total failure, is that they changed a lot from the first one. The GhostRider form was more serious not fun. It's a fictional character, it shouldn't be realitized, the first ghost rider was totally awesome but a mass production bike with a smoke covered coal skulled rusty chain covered piece of rider on it doesn't make a good show. Besides, when It should give the creeps outta the bad guys they shoot the GhostRider like they have seen a usual good guy wearing leather jacket. Total acting failure. I have disgusted from the first 30 minutes, acting is terrible. Maybe someone can say i expect too much, hell yes, but who didn't wanted to see something better. I'm absolutely sad... Please don't attempt to make a third one, or just leave Nicholas Cage out of this business...Thank you...

The aspect of a ghost rider as a general story is very good. However, the dialogue and the plot left something to be desired. The movie had too many unanswered questions such as why does the devil have no power on earth? The idea of good and evil prevails throughout the movie. Unfortunately it was not explored very well in the film. I certainly feel that Nicolas Cage is heading in the same direction as Segel and Van Dam. I thought the sound of the movie was poor. When his motorcycle fired up as the ghost rider it sounded nothing more than a harley that one can hear on the street. You would think that the sound of the bike would be more spectacular. This is not a recommended must see movie. Wait until it comes to Netflex so you don't waste your money.

reviews.review_title: Formulaic Big Bang Marvel Movie Misses the Mark
reviews.content: Amidst the big bangs and special effect enhancements, Marvel's attempt to fine tune the Ghost Rider Franchise results in a great deal of missteps and missed opportunities.Nicholas Cage reprises his role as Johnny Blaze, the tormented host of the Spirit of Vengeance, only this time played with a higher degree of internal strife mixed with insanity. Nicholas Cage is a waste of money who is unable to make the human aspects of the character remotely likable, leaving us longing for "The Rider" & special effects to take over.Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylors decision to push against the ending of the first part of the series where Johnny Blaze swears to use his power for good, to part two's Johnny Blaze trying to remove and suppress his curse was a severe let down. Enter Idris Elba, as our voice of reason, helping to coax the Ghost Rider et Johnny Blaze into a cause larger than himself. The story line filters along the same as the last film whereby the Devil himself is the main source of evil on Earth and "hell-bent" on a glorious reemergence, blah, blah, blah. Only one new character was developed to play opposite the good-evil Ghost Rider & so Johnny Whitworth was tapped to play "Ray Carrigan" a.k.a. Decay. The role was played adequately however never met expectations to really drive our hero from his all-powerful perch, or even stop him from using horribly clichéd lines, thus a lack-luster final battle.After this film the Ghost Rider Franchise is going to need a reboot. The obvious eventuality of the film is pretty clear mid-way through if not sooner but we watch because there are some extremely cool visuals all lit on fire. If you're watching the film it's because you want to see stuff blow up and on fire, this one isn't winning any awards.

reviews.review_title: Would have been a good TV Movie/straight-to-DVD
reviews.content: Before the review let me clear a few things: 1.I really liked the first movie. 2.I am Nicolas Cage fan. 3.Before going to this movie I had already read other reviews. 4.I knew its budget is half than its predecessor.Still I got disappointed.This is the first movie in superhero/comics genre to disappoint me.This isn't an unwatchable movie,far from it.But Its just a movie of straight-to-DVD level.Only good thing about this movie are the scenes involving ghost rider.Ghost Rider action scenes are awesome and bad-ass.But everything else is just pure mediocre. Nicolas Cage is average as Johnny Blaze.All the other actors are sleepwalking through their respective roles.Most disappointing part are the antagonists.They are not threatening enough.It had the potential of being a great dark superhero movie.But alas that chance is blown now.It would have been better as just a made for TV/DVD movie.Watch this movie: 1.If you are a ghost rider fan(As I said earlier Ghost Rider fighting scenes are noteworthy and entertaining,that's why I gave it 3 stars) 2.If you can't get bored by any movie. 3.You want to support Nicolas Cage.For the rest, there is no reason to watch it in a theater. Better wait for its DVD to come out.Then you can judge this movie by yourself.

reviews.review_title: the WORST comic book movie adaptation!!!
reviews.content: Mark Steven Johnson destroyed two very interesting Marvel characters like Daredevil and Ghost Rider...but this???? Come on!! Neveldine & Taylor are not for this kind of movies. They have a particular style of filming that they developed and worked perfectly in Crank and Crank High Voltage..but not here!!!... The thing is..that they've killed the spirit of an amazing Marvel Knights' characters...M.S.Johnson did...Nicholas Cage did..and Neveldine & Taylor did...First of all, the plot...without sense...Danny's character is he or not Danny Ketch the actual Ghost Rider...we'll never know. Johnny Blaze characterization is far from the comic book one...and the story of this film is nothing to do with the Rider's universe... My god...I was hoping that Marvel do a better job than the first one. Like they did with Punisher War Zone, and the imminent The Amazing Spiderman...a very good reboot..Having an amazing story like 'Rise of the Midnight Sons' to make an incredible movie...they did this...and put Christopher Lambert into it...good lord!!! What was Marvel Pictures thinking??? This is Disney's fault...the bought Marvel and they destroyed all the potential in Marvel Universe's future movies...let's hope that the Avengers make me wrong!!

This goes to show you really must read reviews before paying to see a movie, not just think that you liked the first one so the second will be as good. Cage makes Jason Statham look like a great actor. Vinnie Jones would have done better. A bad film can be fun but this wasn't - no catch phrases, no humour, no real style, no story line. This film was less enjoyable than many JCVD or Steven Segal movies. Rutger Hauer at least gives you a wink to let you know he's in on the joke. Daniel Craig seems humorous in comparison to this offering. Big sound and 3D don't make a poor film good. I don't think the efforts to keep to a 12A certificate caused the problem. Would not give this time on Channel 5.:-(

I am a huge fan of ghost rider series although the movie wasn't as great as its first part the visuals and fight scenes where really great but the plot and story wasn't that much the thing about mystical characters is it's hard to balance it through real life but still the cast and the crew behind were able to deliver quite a bit of an amazing experience obviously lot of people didn't like it the cinema was very low the transformation sequence was the only ones when I saw crowd excited but as a fan of the character and the actor I didn't found it that dissapointing so my review is just based on my experience and the truth is I enjoyed it not as much I enjoyed the first one but it was still great hope to see more of this .

Although Nicolas Cage is one of my favorite actors and played in the first Ghost Rider well, even he could not save this movie. The script, overdone graphics, plot holes, and lack of good directing just killed it.The script was tolerable because the overall acting was decent but the Ghost Rider's graphics were very cheesy and seem to just be thrown into the movie in random spots as if to make the scene "seem cooler" than they really was. His powers had mostly no connection whatsoever to the first film and they provide no explanation for the new powers they include in this one. You would think that the director would have done better if they actually watched the first film.Overall, it's an okay to watch for some action, type of movie or just to kill time. However, definitely would recommend skipping if attempting to watch right after the first film. WARNING: PLOT HOLE SPOILERS BELOW!**SPOILER ALERT**They added a literal, sudden, ability for GR to walk in sunlight with no explanation when earlier in the film he could not and he no longer has or utilizes curtain powers from the first film.
Supposedly, "Father and son" have identical abilities yet, son can control GR and Father, suddenly, cannot.It's very irritating when it would have only taken moments to say, this is "such and such" because of "such and such".

reviews.review_title: The best part of going to this movie....
reviews.content: ... was the 15 minute walk from the hotel to the theater.I saw Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance while I was staying in Irvine, CA, for a couple of weeks. But it turned out to be a complete waste of my time and money. This movie is a disgrace for Marvel Comic films or films based on comic books overall. Weak plot, bad acting, poor effects etc. My advice would be not to go see it, even if you did like the first Ghost Rider movie. It's a shame Mystery Science Theater 3000 is no longer running, because this movie would have perfectly fit in there. In fact, I think it's safe to say that this is the movie Dr. Forrester was looking for al these years.

So I went along with my wife to see a screener of this movie and was pretty excited. I watched the first one and thoroughly enjoyed it, plus Ghost Rider was always the "Billy Bad-ass" of comic book heroes, right? Well this is not the case in SOV.First, GR spent a lot of time just kind of standing around and getting his ass kicked. I understand that has to do with building the hype to the point where when he finally does decide to use his power the crowd ooos and ahhhhs. But why? If it was that important why not make the bad guys....bad? At one point he gets shot with a grenade launcher twice and wakes up in the hospital in pain with healing injuries, yet at another point he is annihilated with a Javelin (Call of Duty style) and walks away with no discernible injuries.Next, there is the terrible acting contained in this movie. Even the good actors seem to have trouble coming across the big screen. But most notably there is Violante Placido (who plays Nadya). She seemed incapable of holding a single emotion for any length of time, other than the "mouth breather" face.Then there is the bad guy, who is imbued with the power to "decay." Which when you think about it is a pretty cool power, but here it seems to work whenever it is convenient. I know that sounds weird, but you get the impression that he can not control it (e.g. has no choice when he starts to decay something), evidence by his attempt to eat a sandwich and an apple. However, at later points he touches things that do not decay at all, or decay at a slower pace.Overall, I think the movie had promise, but took a wrong turn when they spent too much time trying to insert comic reliefs, could not get a decent actress, and were themselves confused about the use of powers.

reviews.review_title: Flamed-out after the very first one!
reviews.content: I bought this movie new on DVD at a resale outlet, and I only paid $1 for it as a result. However, the $1 cost was still too much as the storyline was very fragmented and hard to follow. The acting by the majority of the crew was also unconvincing, and the special effects overshadowed a poorly written plot.Accordingly, I can now understand why the Ghost Rider franchise is one of the rare few Marvel Comics movie franchises that Stan Lee has refused to make a cameo appearance in. I also understand why Eva Mendes turned down the opportunity to reprise her role from the previous installment. And while I didn't think that the first Ghost Rider movie was great, it was at least somewhat entertaining, and it was certainly much more watchable than this version. Hopefully, the producers will not decide to do a third Ghost Rider movie with Nicolas Cage in the starring role.Listen, Cage is an Academy Award winning actor whose talents I admire in numerous other roles, but he was never well-suited as a good fit for this specific role. Accordingly, perhaps the producers should either retire the Ghost Rider franchise completely, or they should consider doing a reboot with a different actor at the helm that is directed by a more skilled director with a successful track record. Some that come to mind include: Christoper Nolan (Batman Franchise), McG (Charlie's Angels), Bryan Singer (X-Men), or J.J. Abrams (Lost, Star Trek XI) to name a few. One of them could likely do a much better job on creating a more successful version of the Ghost Rider character, which is based on the comic books.Otherwise, it's very easy to understand why this movie received low ratings due to the lack of well known actors, the poorly written script that resulted in a disjointed/fragmented storyline, and the inability of Nicolas Cage to come across as believable in his dual role as Johnny Cage/The Ghost Rider character. Best wishes to all who watch this movie, and I look forward to a much better interpretation of the Ghost Rider character in the future, as this film severely fell short of the success that many other Marvel Comic book characters have experienced in theaters, once they were converted into films that fans enjoyed.

Even as comic book fanboy I can't find anything good in this movie. It's for sure one of the most uninspired superhero or comic adaptation movies ever! The screenplay is so weak and without any sense that I would suggest to ban Scott M. Gimple, Seth Hoffman & David S. Goyer from their profession or to ever work together on a single screenplay ... or maybe just ban the producers to ever bother us with such crap. The directors Mark Neveldine & Brian Taylor also did a weak job ... they really had some good actors, but it seems they brought out the worst in every one ... not a hard job on Nicolas Cage as we know (again a low mark in his acting career). But even Violante Placido and Idris Elba can't make these disaster of directing and screen writing any better.Totally senseless, uninspired and weak - and I mean this in a really "not cool and not entertaining" way of meaning (since there are really entertaining and cool movies with an uninspired, senseless and even weak story, screenplay or direction!) Totally waste of time!

After the first Ghost Rider movie, I had some high hopes that the second would do a little more justice to the idea than the first. I was wrong. As a long time comic book fan (Marvel) I am greatly aware of the Ghost Rider character. I am disappointed. Nick Cage again, no problem. He did an OK job on the first one. The Director? the special effects? the close-up shaking? the twirling around in a circle? the cuts? the story? I can't see how people can make a movie like this and seriously expect it to make money. Editing, Acting, Storyline. there are so many things wrong with this film, they cant be counted. Marvel Comics must have written this off before the film was even released. I am very disappointed, even more so than Daredevil, but thats another review.

I wanted to believe that everyone was wrong when they warned me about this movie. I loved the first one. I understand that they were trying to be more true to the comics, but you can't completely discount an entire movie in the process. In the first one, he decided he was going to "own the curse" so explain why now he is so desperate to get rid of it when he already had the opportunity? I fell asleep twice during this movie. I've never done this at the movie theater before. So, my boyfriend filled me in on the few minutes I missed. The effects were nice, but the plot was ridiculous. Do yourself a favor and wait for it to come out on DVD if you decide to watch the garbage. The previews where he takes the chain and slams the Devil to the ground is the very end of the movie. This was just a big huge mess.

reviews.review_title: Not enough heat to get you warm
reviews.content: Johnny Blaze sold his soul to the devil. In an ironic case of the truth is stranger than fiction, Nick Cage apparently sold his soul to Hollywood. What was once a competent actor is so far in debt that he is reduced to making anything thrown his way, including this uncalled for sequel to the original from five, yes FIVE years ago. Way to build up the hype. Star Wars this is not. OK there is the requisite token amount of plot. The rest of the movie falls under headline type grabbers such as: "See bad guys blow up!" "See lots of stuff on fire. Yes FIRE!" or "See Nick Cage pretend he still has standards or acting ability!" Don't bother to see this at the theater. I doubt it will last long enough for you to anyway. Wait till it hits Redbox or better yet HBO.

reviews.review_title: Loved the first Ghost Rider, this one was TERRIBLE
reviews.content: I was real excited about a sequel to Ghost Rider. I liked the first one. I was very disappointed. Everything is horrible about this movie. The plot, the writing, the acting, and especially the special effects. In the first move, the flaming skull was sharp, the bike was great, the riders expressions were great. In this movie, the flaming bike looked broken down, the skull wasn't sharp, and the jacket charred. The chain never lit up on fire either. And the penance stare was different. He didn't say look into my eyes or anything. Not to mention again that the writing and the plot were garbage. Don't waste your money on this one. 3d can't help this stink pot. Wait for cable. We will see about the next one If there is.

reviews.review_title: It is not just as bas as they say.
reviews.content: It is not just as bad as they say, it is even worse. This movie without a doubt is one of the worst Marvel movies of all time. The only two things i liked about this movie were 1- The Visual Effects , 2- Violante Placido (because she is hot), other than that the movie is a complete disaster. As of right now i think it is safe to say that Nicolas Cage mastered the art of trash acting. They also included Christopher Lambert which made matters worse by his awful acting. Fergus Riordan is the worst teen actor of all time. This movie is pointless and idiotic. This is one of the movies that are not recommended to anybody, all of this happened because of the lack of good direction and production.

reviews.review_title: Ghost Rider,: questionable comic, questionable movie.
reviews.content: Ghost Rider is a lot of things. My friend loves the comics, but I never got into them. I like your more basic comics like Groo or Spider-Man. This story would seem to be right up my ally as I like spiritual stories, but I know enough about the Marvel universe to know that Mephisto is not the Christian Devil, and this is why I cannot find any comfort in this story.My main gripe is Marvel's version of the Devil. With the Living Tribune, what is the concern for all those souls, other than to sell comics to those who confide in this story type. Marvel might as well tried to script their own version of the Illuminati, which Cage was involved in, coincidentally.In the case of this film, I liked my friend's stories more. The image of a man on fire, able to wrangle in demons with a chain lit on fire, seemed better in mind than in my eyes. Quite honestly, the CGI was so transparent that it edged on "Uck" status. Not sure how a camp used a technology that would not stand up against a few years time.The story was thin, which was comparable to Constantine. All in all, thanks, but I'll pass.

reviews.review_title: What the hell did I just watch?
reviews.content: This movie just proves to me that Nic Cage is a horrible actor. I like SOME of his movies, mostly the quirky ones with Las Vegas in the title somewhere, or Wild at Heart. But the first GR was mediocre at best. When I heard the filmmakers were aware of the flaws of the first, I had slightly higher hopes for this one. I was wrong!!!This is worse than some of the SCYFY originals I have seen! Glad I didn't pay big bucks to see it in 3D! I can't even recommend this one for rental. Maybe a late night free viewing, but I don't want to go too far. The good - not much. The effects were cool at times, but the GR face started to annoy me after a few minutes. The one scene that was somewhat cool but over the top was the second (I think) appearance of GR at the arms deal when he gets in a giant earth mover and wreaks havoc. The bad - acting. All of the actors were horrible. Even Idris Elba was just OK, but he didn't have much to work with. The horrible - Story (can't believe the story came from the guy who gave us Batman Begins and The Dark Knight!), pacing, editing, camera angles, pretty much everything else.
It seems like another flick is getting some negative reviews but not by somebody who is actually into Marvel. The only downfall is the ritual that was unnecessary. Otherwise not bad.

reviews.review_title: huge bore....but ghost rider him self was interesting.
reviews.content: After watching this right after the first one, I have to say I was a little disappointed. First let me point out that the camera usage in this film is a little odd. When I say odd, its good but its about quality as you would expect from a good Youtube video. It seems like every scene in the sunlight is overly exposed and camera never holds still, it looks like someone is doing this on a hand held camera. Another thing to mention is the new look of the Ghost Rider himself which I have to say...Its not bad, just a different tone. The original film made his skull clean, sharp and white, the bike was a huge chopper with an awesome design and his jacket was nice tough clean leather that looked brand new each time. Having it be this way made him a lot more fun because he looked like a Marvel comic character come to life. In this version, his jacket is torn and beaten, the bike is dirty, dented and looks more like a Harley from hell, and his skull was almost black and scared. I say this ins't bad because even though it is a big change in comparison to the original, this is probably would be what a real Ghost rider would look like. This look made him a lot more evil and sinister making this one a bit more intimidating. He was more of an out of control monster from a horror film then a Marvel Comic. You even see him at one point actual send someone to hell, like literally, a giant hole opens up in the ground and someone is launched into the pits of hell. Besides that there isn't much to say about this film. Besides the action is was rather boring, almost none of the characters are likable, very forgettable and....no, this whole film is forgettable. I give it 4 out of 10 because even though it was boring, it could have been a lot worse. I would say watch it once for the fight scenes, but certainly don't buy it.

Ghost Rider 2 was a terrible movie, from all viewpoints; story, acting, special effects, camera-work, dialogue, settings, costumes, props, you name it...extremely disappointing, poorly done! Shame on the director, writer, and even the actors for displaying this C Movie. Potential was great, as I thoroughly enjoyed the first one, but very sad to see it wasted with the lousy directing! I liked Peter Fonda, as the devil, and his past as the "Easy Rider". Where was he? And who can say anything about Eva Mendes, but grrrrreat things. She was sorely missed, and needed badly to add some zing to this flop! 1 star out of 10...is all it deserves.

I really liked the the first Ghost Rider movie. So when I when I went to see this one, my expectations were mixed, and within the first 10 minutes I was like, uh-oh, this is terrible. The camera jumped around during the action scenes. The acting and humor were ridiculous. I did like how the ghost rider's skull and jacket were burnt this time. This was not what I expected, the trailer and commercials were misleading. The filmmakers managed to turn a dark and exciting character into a complete flop. The ritual scene with the Devil and the boy was just ridiculous. So all in all, I do not recommend seeing this movie, even if the previews and commercials, do look cool. Parts where Johny Blaze tries to not turn to the ghost rider ruined it.

First of all I have to start by saying I loved the first Ghost Rider, but this one made me mad.3D: I thought this might be a good one to see in 3D, with chains flying in your face and things like that, but there was no point. In all the cities in my area they didn't even give you a choice of seeing it in 3D or not. If that's the case, there had better be a reason for 3D and it had better be good. There wasn't for this movie.Action sequences: I know a lot of films are doing this now, but I hate it when they jiggle the cameras around and flash quickly between close up shots of something that you can't identify and you have no idea what is going on. This is made worse by the 3D effect. I'm sure they think it's more realistic, like you're actually there, but the would be spectacular scene is lost. I'd be way more amazed if they zoomed out and kept the camera steady so we could actually see what was happening.Nicolas Cage: He was hardly in the film, and I don't just mean because he was computer generated half the time. Both Johnny and his alter ego Ghost Rider weren't there that much. There was more focus on the other characters and because it was only 1.5 hours long (which I think is too short for a marvel story) Johnny Blaze/Ghost Rider didn't get enough air time.Appearance: I understand Ghost Rider has been going through hell and he's looking decrepit, but I was sad not to see the cool leather jacket with the spikes, tight leather pants, boots on the bike. His bike was looking pretty beat up too. Instead of cool and sexy, he was just plain blah. I didn't like how they did his transformation or how his skull looked either, sorry to say.Behavior: I guess it was because he's gone insane, but I didn't like how G.R. didn't really say anything. He just jerked his head like some kind of animal. He didn't point at people and pass his judgement: guilty or innocent. When he stared into a person's soul it just went on and on, the two of them staring at each other like they forgot to put in the clip showing all the person's past sins. Then the bad guy just turned to dust. It was completely unsatisfying when they didn't get their eyes burnt out by seeing all they'd done in the past. I also missed how G.R. would whip the chain around then wrap it over his shoulder.Story: The idea was good (the whole son of the devil thing) but they didn't use it to its full potential. (Again the 1.5 hour length didn't leave them much time.) I didn't like how they redid the back story of him making a deal with the devil and changed it. (This also ate up Nicholas Cage's and this story's air time.) I wished they'd shown more of what's been happening to Blaze since the last film as well.Things that didn't make sense: Maybe I missed something when I watched it in the theatre, but I don't understand how G.R. gets blown up by a grenade and ends up in the hospital then later gets hit by a bazooka and it doesn't bother him one bit. (I'm sure there were other thing's that didn't make sense, but it's been a while since I saw it, so I don't remember them now.) The Devil: I wish Peter Fonda had reprized his role.In the end I think you still should at least see this movie if you were a fan of the first one. I just warn you that you will be frustrated and probably angered by parts of it. I do really hope they make another one just so they can make it better than this one and give the fans some satisfaction, which in this case shouldn't be hard after this.

reviews.review_title: It's Nicolas Cage...with MORE BAD acting
reviews.content: Okay, okay, I admit that I LOVE comics even though I am a girl. lol. So, like many other people who watched this with eager eyes, my eyes were simply burned out of my head and my brain cells erupted into dust. Well, not exactly, but really close. Not only does the movie have bad acting that makes even the drama club cringe, but the camera is shaking throughout THE WHOLE MOVIE. And on top of that, there are bright poorly made graphics that make you dizzy with each turn. I'm glad I didn't see it in 3D. And what's with the overly exaggerated faces? Does he have to scream everywhere? And the worst part is, instead of getting on with the movie, they stop it to show some weird animation that explains the story and it's basically pointless. With all this animation, they might as well make it into a cartoon. All the funny acting and faces would totally make up for it.

Now we know how the first part was, though the screen play and the graphics were not that appealing, it was worth a watch. So when i was told that there was a second part to this, i thought "alright may be these guys were saving it for the sequel", and i almost cried thinking on what else i could have spent the money i used for the tickets.The graphics was worse than the first ghost rider and whats with the attitude of the lead. directing sucks, among st all the people, i know that Cage can put up a real good show. but there was no scope for acting in this film, and as for the story it could have been much better and seriously the narration was a big time failure.the only thing you would be happy about is that this movie lasts only 90 odd minutesEvery second throughout the movie you would have the feeling "now that could have been done better". so its up to you- if you have nothing to do and need to waste money and feel depressed- go for it.

it's one of the worst sequel movie i have ever watched.............. The screenplay and direction are so bad look like low budget movie........... It's like to hell sitting one & half hour to watching that type crap. Please don't watch..if you don't want to waste your money and most importantly time. I have lot of expectation from this movie.. but it's not up to mark........ So Plz Don't ....... Go for it! I may be wrong as a true Critic. It's from my side of review...... So be wise. This movie is not 10% of the first movie of Ghost Rider. NicolaS Cage is helpless against such direction.. The film has many sensible fault.You can easily recognize those while watching the movie.

I'm a big Ghost Rider fan, and I thought the first film was OK, just lacked a notable bad guy. I thought this was meant to be an improvement on that. Unfortunately it wasn't. The first shot of the Ghost rider just keeps cutting to him standing there and slightly moving his head one way and another, then cuts to bad guys watching him then him again moving his head slightly. What the heck? You get into a fight with bad guys run them off the road and then just stand around posing for a teen heart throb photo shoot for the next 10 minutes? Then when he finally moves (there's about 10 bad guys)He just grabs one and we have a four minute close up of him staring at him doing nothing. Giving other bad guys all the time in the world to organise a devastating attack and escape. This is so unrealistic and trite it ruins the tone of the entire film. I get from the comics this was supposed to be a soul stare, but they needed to add some special effects to show this, on film it didn't look like anything was happening and just looked meaningless and idiotic. This then set the tone for a what was a disappointing film. Nicolas Cage did some fantastic acting, but the action was stunted with pointless pauses (if you're going to keep pausing the action for soul stares, then you need something to show that a soul stare is taking place), the plot holes were enormous chasm's, the Ghost Rider under used and made to look stupid. The best bit of the film was the dialogue from Moreau (Idris Elba) Again tellingly the bad guy was too under done. No sense of menace, no presence, and at no point did it make you feel as though the bad guy could have succeeded even if his only protagonist was Maggie from the Simpsons. (mind you in the 500th episode she kicked butt more convincingly than Ghost Rider did in this film.) This could have been a great film it wasn't. The Ghost Rider was under used, and then mainly just stood round and looked pretty. The soul stare, used a few time, just looked like four minutes of pointlessly looking into the bad guys eyes like a teen romance flick. It needed a special effect adding to show it was doing "something". And without doubt, Ghost Rider needs a menacing protagonist. A bad guy who has presence and menace, without that this could only ever be disappointing.

reviews.review_title: The first movie was great this is Trash.
reviews.content: Having watched the first movie with decent actors and fantastic storyline and superb special effects. His motor bike wasn't a chopper with the skull face and chain like frame. Well done to the new directors/writers and producers for destroying a great character and movie. TOTAL WASTE OF TIME - PLEASE BRING BACK THE ORIGINAL CREW................................................PLEASE HELP SAVE OUR GHOST RIDER - BRING BACK ORIGINAL DIRECTOR/WRITER/PRODUCER.....

reviews.review_title: 10 stars because of how low it's rated
reviews.content: Great movie. I rate it 10 stars because of how low it's rated.

reviews.review_title: Couldn't make it through the full movie
reviews.content: I watched this a week ago and it was so bad that I'm bothering to review it so others can avoid my fate. I only watched about 80 minutes. So, I suppose it's really unfair for me to rate this movie but on the other hand, this production company just stole 80 minutes of my life so maybe it all just equals out. reviews.review_title: Not worth the time spent watching it.
reviews.content: Since it is based on a comic book I expected there to be things that were slightly over the top with a plot that would probably not be acceptable anywhere else. So I was not disappointed with any of that, even though there was plenty. There was a lot of action with fire, gunfights and explosions. There were a few witty lines and some good effects and times of comic book fun. But I hate the way it was shot. There was some split screen stuff I didn't like, and the picture would jump around in a way I found unpleasant, some fast camera moves that didn't make things easier to follow, and several shots that you could tell were there simply for the 3D effect and I hate when a film does that (and I saw it in 2D so the shots were even worse.) If you are a huge Ghost Rider fan or in love with Nicholas Cage go ahead and see this one, just don't expect too much. If you are neither of those I wouldn't bother.

I Can't believe they ruined one of the best Marvel heroes ever made. At least the first movie had Ghost Rider doing things from the comics and made his costume look correct. reviews.content: I can't believe that David S. Goyer wrote this, the dark years when Marvel showed us Elektra, Daredevil, Fantastic Four... reviews.review_title: First movie I have wanted to ask for a refund
reviews.content: I took my oldest son to this movie, based on what we had been seeing in regards to the previews on TV, it looked like this was going to be a winner.And it was anything but a winner. The overall acting in this movie was very "B'. And that statement goes for Nicholas Cage's performance, in fact I would have to say this was one of his worst performances. To me, it felt like he was bringing himself down to the other actors levels, or perhaps the directors wanted this "cheesy B movie" feeling and he and the other actors accommodated, I am not sure honestly. But no matter the reason, the overall feel of this movie was just "B" at best.What I do know is that after the movie, my son mentioned to me that he really wanted to just get up and leave after the first twenty minutes or so, and I laughed. And the reason I laughed is because I had thought the same thing, but had not verbalized that thought to him during the movie. Had I, and he told me he felt the same way, I would have actually gone up to the movie manager and asked for a refund, which would have been the very first time I had ever done that due to just not liking a movie.Don't waste your time and money on this one, it is not worth it. And most especially not worth the extra charge due to it being a 3d movie.Mediocre acting, mediocre special effects and just an all around bad movie. Very sad, because I did like the first one. Now I doubt I would be willing to spend money to watch a third, just because I would be afraid it would wind up as bad as this one.

reviews.review_title: Well... IMDb wont let me give it "zero" rating
reviews.content: My suggestion Don't WATCH THIS MOVIE. If u have a option of only watching this movie or else bore to death prefer the death option. This is one of the worst Marvel movies. During whole time I watch the movie I kept on wondering whats happening and still wondered the same after the movie was over.I think even the cast of the movie & the producers & directors were not able to figure what they are doing or making. The action is awful The 3D is awful. The movie is painful to see All the powers of Ghostriders were lost its seems. He was a made into a joke. I hope they done make a sequel to this one.I had to take 2 Disprins to overcome the headache.

So what can be said about Ghost Rider? Other than i didn't go to the cinema with the expectation that this was going to be a awesome film. Turns out i was right. With the works of Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylor the directors of Crank 1 and 2 they succeeded in making one of the most awesome marvel characters ''Jonny Blaze''(Ghost Rider)a laughing stock for all to see, the entire film was nothing more than a complete joke. Put that with Nicolas Cage's acting and Spirit of Vengeance was born, how Cage is an a established actor as he is, is beyond me. The films intention to be a Dark and Ominous superhero action film like we saw in the trailer is pathetic thanks to Cage's inability to perform no other character than the same erratic bizarre character we see him play in all his movies. Also with the excessive amount of CGI and special effects and terrible one liner's such as ''Roadkill'' makes it even harder to take this film seriously. Overall I wouldn't recommend this film to anyone unless they wanted to laugh at its complete lack of potential and would strongly recommend that it's by far the worst film made in 2012 up to now.

This movie came out over 10 years ago now, and I remember being excited to see it in the theatres because I thought the first Ghost Rider was fun in a super campy kind of way. I remember sitting there watching it and the tonal changes were borderline shocking. It has the eclectic, spastic, shaky cam style you expect from the directors of Crank, while also utilizing their strange style of campy over the top humor. It didn't work for me back then, but upon rewatching it now in 2023 I was shocked at how much I really enjoyed the movie. I think it just needed to age and find a time for appreciation in a world so over saturated with direct to streaming schlock that even the worst movies from before the Netflix/Prime/Hulu/etc age seem more enjoyable. It's a darker film than the first in a lot of ways, as was the goal of the Marvel Knights banner (which only produced one other film, Punisher War Zone) and it left a lot of gaps in the storyline for the viewer to fill in on their own, including wondering who the villain with the white hair was supposed to be (he was Blackout, by the way) and why there was this weird fish eye lens and darkness when he was on the attack. But now, watching it again, I didn't find myself asking those questions. I found myself really enjoying it for what it is. A bad movie that finally aged to the point where it's become good, in a bad way. The ghost rider transformations are never shown in the entirety, but the scene on the motorcycle where Johnny is fighting it off and it's coming in spurts was one of my favorite scenes in the film. The damsel in distress was one dimensional yet again. And Cage employs his Face/Off over the top insanity to his best effect. Overall, it's a film I truly believe will have a cult following as there is an unfortunate lack of Ghost Rider adaptations out there and this one is a lot of fun. There are also fun cameos by Christopher Lambert and Idris Elba (who has a little more than a cameo but is still under used.)

While i mostly agree id also like to point out that i don't understand why make the first movie if you are going to disregard it? I don't know if this is a spoiler. But in the first movie his bike would transform. In this one it just catches on fire! I gotta say i was really looking forward to seeing how this truck would transform. was this movie made in Hollywood? Why did nicholas cage look soooo old. Im a big fan of ghost rider, Nicholas cage and quite honestly thought the first movie laid the groundwork for a killer sequel. In the first one he gets hit by a truck. No damage gets his jaw broken and he just puts it back. In this one he has a bunch of scars.

reviews.review_title: Neveldine/Taylor should quit making from comic-book adaptations.
reviews.content: I've been following the rumors of a Ghost Rider sequel since I saw the first Ghost Rider, which I thought was decent, had a good origin story, action scenes and proper character development. When I found out that the sequel was going to be helmed by Neveldine/Taylor, I freaked out. I saw Gamer and both Crank movies, and was not surprised, and I saw how the potential of a great actor, such as Gerard Butler, get wasted. I read some reviews about the way they filmed movies as daredevils and thought it could be awesome, but for Ghost Rider: Spirit Of Vengeance didn't seem to work. Towards the beginning of the movie, I was getting dizzy from all the camera changes, zooms and and twists.Then I started reading from their approach to the character. I read that they wanted to change the appearance from the first film, and to be honest, I thought it was OK from the first film. The melted jacket, the black skull, and the new motorcycle just didn't seem to work for me. I thought the looks were horrible, and I hated the motorcycle in this movie. The extra abilities of the Hellcycle, such as defying gravity or riding through water were absent. One of the most enjoyable things from the first movie was the sound of the motorcycle and the light motorcycle band approach. Also, in this movie, Johnny Blaze seems like a complete different character. He's just a crazy guy running, doesn't seem to be brace or that he would like to do stunts anymore even so he's been doing stunts since he was a kid with his dad.First off, if you want to make a film about a comic-book character, you need to do some proper research. I was amazed when I learned that they didn't even researched who Blackout was. In this movie, Blackout is only seen as a thug, not like a main villain or someone strong enough to meet GR's match. Also, Blackout is NOTHING like his comic-book counterpart. You can read it at Marvel or even at Wikipedia. They even forgot what being loyal to the comics is all about.About the Ghost Rider himself: there was never any clue or hint about him using the Penance Stare. There are some scenes where he fights some guys and NONE of 'em are even afraid they are seeing a flaming skeleton with a chain. Did I say chain? Yeah, the chain. That mystical chain just seemed like a rope. It didn't even flame up and it appeared magically when he changed to GR. The shotgun was missing too, and it's another of the GR weapons. Also, they try to make GR a hero. HE'S NOT A HERO. He's an anti-hero, but besides that, he barely even speaks and in this movie he is seen like a beast let off leash, much like Hulk. In the end of the first movie, we can see that he has some moderate control over his powers and that he can go flaming inferno at will without suffering some pain. I expected after the second change for him to have a personality. In the first film, we can see he judges people over being guilty or not. In here he just swoops in and kills people... NOT like he should. I also think Nick Cage's performance was awful. He's a good actor, but he screwed this film. All I saw was GR or Nick doing crazy stuff with bad acting. The film lacked a lot of character development and had a lot of misplaced humor. I thought the pissing scene and the Twinkie scene were really immature and unnecessary.I was really disappointed with this movie, having believed that it had the potential to beat its predecessor, but I was mistaken... gravely mistaken. Congratulations, Neveldine/Taylor. You ruined what could have a been a great franchise. People think that visual effects make a movie and they are wroooong. This movie had some, but had a weak story, few characters, no love interest and crappy acting. I think the best part of the movie was Idris Elba. Besides that, the popcorn. GR 1 is way better, not the best Marvel film, but a decent film. If you want to go see it, go ahead, but you have been warned. Also, don't waste your money in 3D. It's grotesque.

I, like others, had looked forward to a sequel to Ghost Rider but was really disappointed in this version. The first Ghost Rider was good and a good intro to the character. This movie could have been much better and possible made room for more but Nick Cage has made sure there will probably never be another GR. I will have to say that Nicolas Cage is the reason this movie is bad, his take on the Ghost Rider as a lunatic and a merciless killing machine I do not believe to be in-tune with Johnny Blaze from the comic books, or in line with the representation of him in the first movie. When Cage is being a human is acting is on par with the other in the film but when he is struggling with the inner rider or actually being the rider it is almost too hard to watch. I found myself hoping that he would not transform just so I could finish the movie.The penetant stare in this movie is just stupid, not to mention that the one person he really stares down then turns to ash, so whats the point. If interested rent it for a dollar but don't expect much. And I hope that never make another one.

reviews.review_title: Worse than the last one, but I get the story.
reviews.content: When I talk to my friends about Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance, almost all of them said it was terrible. Now, I decide to watch it at home and my friends are right. But I like the plot except the changed plot when and before Johnny Blaze become the Ghost Rider.I also like when he turns every vehicle he touches and uses turns into fire. I dislike most when the Ghost Rider dodges bullets by spinning in mid-air about 30 seconds and suddenly stops and attacks an enemy. I want to say "what the heck, but I just watch it quietly.I will say the worst sequel of the year!!! But I will stay on a mixed review.

I loved the first Ghost Rider.I was excited when I heard about the second...but quickly changed from excitement to disappointment within the first 15 minutes of the movie.If the greatness of a movie can be based on special effects, then this would get an academy award, but that's the only thing it has going for it. The acting was cardboard at best, the story weaker than watered down iced tea, and there was absolutely no enjoyability to it.It left me wondering what happened to Nicholas Cage. Once upon a time he was a decent actor. I would enjoy watching his movies. However recently his acting ability has declined greatly. I would love to see him return to the days of movies like Moonstruck and The Rock. Come on Nick, Snap Out Of It!

reviews.review_title: i just couldn't believe how awful it was
reviews.content: I NEVER wrote anything for the IMDb. But as soon as I came home from the theater, I just had to write my opinion. I am a big fan of special effects, sci-fi, fantasy, action, horror and generally movies. BUT in the first few minutes, you could see that the film is going to be a.w.f.u.l. OK newest trend is to make movies in 3d. I love it. But if I'm going to watch anything in 3d i expect to SEE something. Camera-work was so terrible, like it was made accidentally, just imagine a cameraman rolling around and saying: well if I catch anything it will be fine,if I don't we'll write it to the "action". WTF. I regretted making laser surgery because my eyeballs sored, and for what? GR I., well that was a great film. My cousins and I couldn't wait for the second part to arrive to Croatia-weren't we surprised?! It had nothing remotely similar to GR1- Johhny (Nicholas Cage) was shown as totally crazy person with 10 minutes of showing you his rage/laughter in a manner the Mask meet the Twoface, it was hideous and not at all entertaining. The story? What story? It was like they made it along the way. One sentence that was said in stupid conversation overwhelmed the ending of the film. All rules were broken and a probability of a exquisite saga was shattered to pieces. While we were still in cinema, you could see the hysteric laugher of people, people saying: I hope it is nominated for the golden raspberry; some people went outside in the middle of the movie.I just don't understand how they could destroy the franchise in such a way.DON'T THROW YOUR MONEY AWAY. Turn 180 degrees from the entrance to the cinema. Awful doesn't describe it.

reviews.review_title: This movie couldn't be more disappointing
reviews.content: It's unbelievable how these guys released this total crap. I mean, the first movie was awesome and I was looking forward in seeing this one only to discover Nicholas Cage flirting in Romanian. "Eşti frumoasă!" Seriously?! The whole acting was hilarious, like they were filming a parody, not the sequel to the 2007 film. You can't just mix an American movie with Romania. That is...(screaming).WHYYYYY? At first, I wasn't sure that was actually happening, because..well who would do that? Honestly I couldn't watch the movie at its full length, it hurt. If you're looking for something worse than Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance, try The Necro Files (1997). I couldn't watch that either.

I liked the first Ghost Rider. But this sequel, if that's what this movie is, is just awful. The writing is awful, the special effect are poorly done and the acting is sub par. The camera shots are so choppy that at times it almost gives one a headache. The ghost rider no longer looks into people's eyes, instead he just runs around killing people. The skull and hands no longer have a good fire effect. Instead it looks like they added it behind the skull as an afterthought. The chain is no longer a fiery whip. This movie is so bad that I'd really like to give it a negative rating. I saw this movie for free. Even so, I'm just mad that I wasted two hours of my life watching this garbage. Don't waste your time. If you like the first Ghost Rider stay away from this one.

This was the absolute worst movie ever! You would think that the creators of this movie would have at least followed the first one. It is supposed to mimic the Marvel comics, but the graphics were horrible. The Ghost Rider looked old, tired and used. What happened to the cool chopper he rode in the first movie? The ugly heap of junk in this movie should have been at the dump not on scene. What was with the stare with the open mouth? I kept waiting for something to happen but nothing ever did. There was absolutely no storyline until about the last ten minutes or so. I am disappointed that Nicholas Cage would even consider this storyline. The acting the was the worst I've seen in a long time, which is a shame because I love Nicholas Cage. The psycho facial expressions made by Nicholas Cage were so lame and fake. No acting involved in this one. Please, please spare us number three. I don't think we can handle another dive of a movie.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst superhero movies
reviews.content: A disappointing superhero flick, this superhero movie fails in several aspects. The acting is awful, and Nicholas Cage, in no way, does a decent job in portraying the character. The story is simple, in fact too simple, with no surprises.The performances are horrible, and while humor can sometimes help make a movie entertaining, this one overdoes it, with too much humor in places it doesn't belong. No actor can save this movie, and even the special effects doesn't surpass recent superhero films.There is no strong plot to keep viewers entertained, but the plot really puts people off. A superhero movie not worth watching.1/10

reviews.review_title: A bad movie from start to finish
reviews.content: This sequel does not even follow the story line from the first film. It was not even a attempt at a reboot it just sucked. I felt sorry that Christopher Lambert even signed for the small roll he had in this film. The story line never played out or looked into to more of the angel of justice, that would have made an incredible story line. The death of Moreau was at most a waste of time but felt like an insult to the watcher. It would have been a better line to have given him a set of powers and survive to be the boy's guardian. The acting was forced almost like they were acting at gun point just to get it over and done with. I mean the Fx's were so bad I thought my 2 year old could do better with a etch a sketch. My cats could have written a better story. Skip this movie and go to the beach instead.

Never thought I'd say this about a Marvel movie, but DAAAAANG, This is really really really REALLY bad !!! And not bad is in good; bad is stinking bad !!!! I can't believe Nicolas Cage attached himself to such a weak production and screenplay. My god this is bad. And I'm a fan of the Captain America with Matt Salinger. So you can imagine how bad this is must be.A short overview of this movie : - the script sucks - the camera work is shoddy (the wanted effect is incredibly bad) - the performance of N.C. is nowhere near his usual level (even Bangkok Dangerous was better than this), - the coloring is all wrong - there's no transformation - Christophe Lambert is in it (which lately has come to mean it can't be good) - there's an overall lack of conviction - the accents are bad beyond belief - the editing looks like a mix between a documentary & a bad 80's punk video - Stan Lee hasn't got a cameo in itThe only good thing in this movie is the joke with the Twinkie (and that ain't even a joke).So glad i didn't buy it when it came out. At least I haven't spent too much money on it (bought a Blu-ray for only a 3,99 euro, about 5$).Damn this is bad. I just can't get over it.Hope the next Marvel Knight movies will be better.

I was generally disappointed with this film, the connection to the first one is virtually non existent, containing a different back story to the first film???? I was hoping for a similar style of plot with a better bad guy, the bad guy in this was just rubbish, bad character, bad acting, bad dialog, a theme for the film in my opinion. I won't spoil the film if you want to watch it but I will say that the first film is better, the bike is better, the rider is better and the storyline is better. My advice would be to watch ghost rider the directors cut instead.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I've seen in years
reviews.content: Straight up, this movie sucked, it was probably the worst movie that I've seen in a very long time. The plot is incredibly bland and predictable, as well as being riddled with logical fallacies. This is a prime example of a movie that tried to have more flair than substance and bombed it really badly.The whole thing is plagued by pacing issues, at times accelerating between plot points with nothing to link them together into a cohesive story, only to slow down and drag out a fight scene several minutes longer than it should have with pointless 'cool' scenes. There was one point in the movie were the main character spent a good 3 standing in one spot and screaming, after spending another three minutes dancing while the bad guys stared at him, achieving absolutely nothing.The choreography in the fight scenes was pathetic. A repetitive cycle of a bad guy shooting at the main character and not harming him, then the main character lashing out with his chain, touching the bad guy, and then the bad guy instantly dying. There was no motion, no flair and the end result was it being boring as hell to watch.All up, this movie would have fared better if they just completely took all the supernatural parts out of it and just treated it as a straight up action/thriller film. Utterly abysmal 2/10.

reviews.review_title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Montezuma's Vengeance
reviews.content: Ghost Rider 2: Spirit of Crap... One of the worst movies I have ever seen...worse than those deliberately-bad Tarantino exploitation flicks...it's like the director was high on crack...and all the actors, too... Nick Cage overacted it to hell, for validity, I guess...apparently the new director was telling Cage to play Johnny Blaze like a neurotic, psychotic crack fiend, maybe even sending him home with a big bag o' crack to help Cage stay in character. I rented this one from Redbox--for a dollar. It's hard to make a movie that's not worth renting for $1, so I guess they should be really proud of themselves for making this huge pile. I quit watching this POS 30 mins. in, and I won't ever pick it up again...I couldn't be paid to watch this film...it's that bad. No plot, horrible characters...the kid at the center of the 'story', is not only NOT likable, but basically Damien, or the Antichrist of some sort... It's like SOMEBODY had enough money to BUY the character to make this movie, hoping to absolutely ruin the entire series. The 'Rider's skull has been elongated like one of the aliens in the last (hopefully) Indiana Jones movie, and--instead of fighting during his first appearance--he pops and locks like Dave Chappelle's crack-smoking character Tyrone Biggums...Cage now plays Jonny like some twisted lunatic--I don't know how he read this and didn't threaten to quit the set...maybe he needs the money for his own crack habit. Johnny Blaze is no longer the 'Jeckyl & Hyde' character who fights his own demons--he plays it as if he's given completely over to 'the madness', gloating and threatening everyone in this dog-of-a-film. The female actor (you ARE kidding--her name means 'Violent Peace'--what a hippie!) is much worse, acting like she is doing some kind of soft- porn international art nuveau film...again, just awful. Gone are the days of any good characters for Cage, I suppose...would any actor these days stop production and threaten to walk off if they were expected to go along with this? We can only hope. Comparing this comic book hero movie to the latest Iron Man movies (w/ Robert Downey Jr.) is like comparing a Triple Crown winner to a dog wiping his butt on a cheap throw rug. Horrible...all involved parties should be sued for 'character assassination' (that character being the 'Ghost Rider').
